title: I forgot my Singpass password. How do I reset it?

answer.body:
Check out our interactive guide here


If you have set up your Singpass 2FA, you can reset your password instantly online:

  1. Click here to reset your password

  2. Enter your NRIC or FIN details, followed by Singpass Face Verification or SMS One-Time Password

  3. Create your new Singpass password


Alternatively, you may request for a PIN mailer to be sent to your registered address. You will receive your PIN mailer in 3 working days.

title: How do I register for a Singpass account?

answer.body:
Check out our interactive guides here



Before you register for a Singpass account:


Check that you fulfil the following eligibility requirements:

  • You are at least 15 years old

  • You are a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident or Foreign Identification Number (FIN) holder.


Ensure that the address on your NRIC or FIN card is correct. If you need to update your address with the relevant authorities, please click here.



To register for a Singpass account:


  • Click here to register for a Singpass account

  • Register instantly with Singpass Face Verification or request for a One-Time Password PIN mailer

  • The One-Time Password PIN mailer will be mailed to your registered address within 3 working days for a local address and 10 working days for an overseas address (depending on the overseas postal services).


Need more guidance? Refer to our interactive guides or our instructional guide for step-by-step instructions on how to register for a Singpass account.

title: I have changed my mobile number. How do I update it in Singpass?
body: Change mobile phone number

answer.body:
To update your mobile number, there are several options:

 
Option 1: Update Profile

  • Visiting Singpass User Portal (click https://go.gov.sg/singpass-login)

  • Login to Singpass User Portal using

    • Singpass App - Scan QR

    • Singpass Face Verification - Click Password Login, enter your user ID and password followed by performing a Singpass Face Verification

    • Singpass SMS 2FA (if you still have access to your old mobile number) - Click Password Login, enter your user ID and password followed by performing SMS 2FA.

  • Once logged in, you can select 'Update Profile' icon to update your new mobile number.

 
Option 2: Not my mobile number

  • Visiting Singpass User Portal (click https://go.gov.sg/singpass-login)

  • Login to Singpass User Portal - Click Password Login, enter your user ID and password

  • At the SMS OTP screen, click on "Not my mobile number" and follow the screen's instructions to update your mobile number

 
Option 3: Visit Singpass counters

  • Visit any of our Singpass counter (click https//go.gov.sg/singpass-counters for counter locations) to seek assistance to update your mobile number

  • Please bring along the necessary document for verification, such as your original NRIC or FIN card.

title: What is an authentication certificate?

answer.body:
When setting up the Singpass app on your device, you will be issued a digital identity by the National Certification Authority (NCA). This is used as proof of your online identity whenever you transact with Singpass.


Your digital identity is represented by the authentication certificate issued to you. It comes with a unique serial number that can be seen in your Singpass app settings, under "Digital identity details".


The authentication certificate is valid for 1 year in Singpass app. Once it expires, you will be prompted to renew the authentication certificate. You can proceed to renew the certificate, in order to continue using the Singpass app.

title: I forgot my Singpass ID. What is my Singpass ID?

answer.body:
When you set up your Singpass account, your system-generated Singpass ID is your NRIC/FIN by default.

If you set up your Singpass ID before, you can click here to retrieve it online.

title: Singpass App Onboarding Pre-requisite

answer.body:
Please ensure you have updated to the latest version of Google Play Store or Huawei AppGallery.


To view your Play Store version, follow these steps:

  • Go to the Play Store app, tap on user account > “Settings” > “About”

  • Play Store must be at least version 40

  • Ensure “Play Protect certification” shows that “Device is certified”



If you are using a China ROM device with sideloaded Play Store:

  • Update OS if a new version is available

  • Don’t rely on the “Update Play Store” button in the Play Store app

  • If the device has its own vendor's app market (eg: Oppo App Market, Vivo V-Appstore, Xiaomi Get Apps), search for Play Store on the market and update the Play Store app from there

  • Otherwise, using the same method when installing Play Store on the device, manually check and update the Play Store app


Additional Guide:

  • Ensure the Google or Huawei server is connectable

  • Open the Play Store or Huawei AppGallery to allow the app to synchronise with the server

  • If you are in China, Google service may be blocked by the local service provider. Using a Singapore roaming data plan may resolve the connection issue

title: How can I use Singpass Face Verification?

answer.body: Log in to any government digital service on your web or mobile browser by entering your Singpass ID and password. Then, select Singpass Face Verification as the 2FA method and follow the instructions on your screen to scan your face. This service works on a computer that is equipped with a web camera or on a smartphone with a front-facing camera.

title: Why have I not received a prompt to renew my authentication certificate when other Singpass users have received one?

answer.body: The authentication certificate renewal process is being implemented in phases for all Singpass users. This phased approach allows for a smoother rollout and better user experience. If you have yet to receive a prompt, do not worry – you will be notified when it is time for you to renew your certificate. In the meantime, you can continue using your Singpass app as usual.

title: Why am I being prompted to renew my authentication certificate?

answer.body: As part of ongoing security enhancements for Singpass accounts, you may be prompted to renew your authentication certificate, even if you have recently done so. Please complete the certificate renewal process when prompted to continue using your Singpass app.

title: I have changed my residential address. How do I update my address in Singpass?
body: Change of address

answer.body:
You need to update your residential address with ICA. After which, your address registered with ICA will be automatically synced with Singpass.


Update your local or overseas residential address with ICA here.

title: I am living overseas. How do I register for a Singpass account?
body: Registering account from overseas

answer.body:
Before you register for a Singpass account


  1. Check that you fulfil the following eligibility requirements:

    • You are at least 15 years old

    • You are a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident or Foreign Identification Number (FIN) holder.


  2. Ensure that your address had been updated with the relevant authorities.

To register for a Singpass account

  • Visit Singpass Portal > Select 'Register for Singpass' under Services

  • Register instantly with Singpass Face Verification or Request for a One-Time Password PIN mailer

  • The One-Time Password PIN mailer will be mailed to your registered overseas address within 10 working days (depending on overseas postal services).


Need more guidance? Refer to our Instructional Guide for step-by-step instructions on how to register for a Singpass account.

title: I got a new mobile device. What should I do to use the Singpass app on this new device?
body: New mobile device

answer.body: You should download and set up the Singpass app on your new device. Once you have activated Singpass app on your new device, the Singpass app on your previous mobile device will automatically be deactivated to ensure security. There is no need to uninstall the app from previous devices.

title: What do I need to set up Singpass app?

answer.body: You will require your smartphone, an Internet connection, and a registered Singpass account.

title: How do I check on my application for a Singpass account?
body: Check application status

answer.body:
1. To check on your application status, click here

  2. Enter the information required

title: Can I install the Singpass app on multiple devices?

answer.body: Singpass app can only be installed on one mobile device at a time. Activating Singpass app on a new device will automatically deactivate the app on your previous device, ensuring that there is only one copy of your credentials. This grants a tighter level of security control and remains convenient for most Singpass users.

title: How do I register for a Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA)?
body: Register for a Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA)

answer.body:
The Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) is only issued by SFA organisations. They are:

  1. Corppass

  2. Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS)

  3. Ministry of Law Singapore (MinLaw)

  4. GoBusiness (by GovTech)


Follow these steps to register for a SFA:

  1. Register your details with the SFA organisation

  2. After successful verification of your details, the SFA organisation will pre-register your SFA 

  3. Singpass will provide your SFA details (Singpass User ID) via email  

  4. Follow the instructions in the email from Singpass to activate your SFA. Or you can read more here on how to set up the Singpass app.

title: Why am I being prompted to renew my signing certificate?

answer.body: As part of ongoing security enhancements for Singpass accounts, you may be prompted to renew your signing certificate, even if you have recently done so. Please complete the certificate renewal process when prompted to continue using your Singpass app.

title: How will the change in issuers for signing and authentication certificates affect me? Do I need to perform any actions in the Singpass app?

answer.body: The usage of the signing and authentication certificate remained unchanged for users. However, during the onboarding or renewal process, users will need to consent to accepting a certificate issued by Government Technology Agency instead of Assurity Trusted Solutions Pte Ltd.

title: I am a Singpass Foreign user Account holder. What is my Singpass ID and how do I retrieve it?

answer.body:
You would have received an email from Singpass with the subject Registration of Singpass account (Foreign Users), sent during the creation of the Singpass Foreign user Account which contains your Singpass ID.
 

If you have already set up your Singpass Foreign user Account, you can retrieve your Singpass ID online: 

You can retrieve your Singpass ID from this link.

Alternatively:

  1. Visit the Singpass portal 

  2. Select 'Services' > 'Retrieve Singpass ID' from the top menu bar

  3. Scroll to the bottom of the page to access the link for a foreign user

  4. Enter your Foreign ID, Country of issuance and email address

  5. Your Singpass ID will be sent to your registered email address

title: I do not have a signing certificate. Can I still digitally sign with Singpass?

answer.body:
No. You will not be able to digitally sign a document if you have not activated your signing certificate. When digitally signing a document with your Singpass app for the first time, you will be prompted to complete a one-time activation of your signing certificate. If you are facing any technical issues, please contact Singpass Helpdesk here.


If you do not need to sign any documents with your Singpass app, you do not have to activate your signing certificate. You may continue to log in to digital services with your Singpass app.

title: How do I change my Singpass password?

answer.body:
To change your Singpass password:


  1. Log in to your account at Singpass Portal

  2. Select 'Change password'

  3. Enter your current and new password, followed by a SMS One-Time Password to verify your new password

title: Who is eligible for Singpass?

answer.body:
The minimum age requirement is 15 years old.


The following groups of users are eligible to apply for Singpass:


  • Singapore Citizen and Permanent Resident

  • Employment Pass and Personalised Employment Pass holders

  • EntrePass holders

  • S Pass holders

  • Dependant's Pass holders (of EP, PEP, EntrePass and S Pass holders)

  • Long Term Visit Pass-Plus (LTVP+) holders

  • Long Term Visit Pass holders

  • Work Permit holders

  • Student Pass holders

  • Immigration Exemption Order holders


For more information, please refer to the instructional guide.

title: Why is there no logout button on the Singpass app?

answer.body:
The Singpass app works as an authenticator and is only triggered when you are accessing a service or your information. It is built to ensure high levels of security, such as requiring the user to perform identity verification using fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode when accessing services or personal information.


If malicious apps or altered settings that may compromise the security of the device is detected, the Singpass app will not be usable until the threat has been neutralised.


We advise all users to password protect their device and set up their own biometric data for secure access. Should you misplace your device, you may install the app on another device to automatically deactivate it on the lost device or call Singpass Helpdesk for assistance.

title: How do I use the QR code scanner on the Singpass app?

answer.body:
To scan a QR code using the Singpass app:


  1. Launch your Singpass app

  2. Tap the 'Scan' button at the bottom to activate the QR code scanner

  3. Hold your phone's camera over the screen to scan the Singpass QR code on the login page

Note: You will need to grant the app permission to your device's camera for this feature to work.

title: Can I customise my Singpass ID?

answer.body:
You may customise your Singpass ID to your preferred username.


  1. Log in to your account on the Singpass Portal.

  2. Click on the 'Update Profile' button.

  3. Click on the 'Change Singpass ID' button next to your current Singpass ID.

title: I have misplaced (or did not receive) my Singpass PIN mailer, what should I do?
body: Misplaced or did not receive PIN mailer

answer.body:
You can request for a new PIN mailer to be sent to you.


  1. Click here (reset password page)

  2. Enter your 'NRIC or FIN number' and 'Date of issue'.

  3. A new PIN mailer will then be sent to your registered address within 3 working days for a local address and 10 working days for an overseas address (depending on the overseas postal service).

title: How do I set up SMS 2FA?

answer.body:
If you are a new Singpass user, please register your mobile number with Singpass upon your first login to activate your SMS 2FA instantly.

If you are an existing Singpass user, you can log into your account at the Singpass Portal > Select the 'Set Up 2FA' icon on the scroll bar. A PIN mailer will then be sent to your address within 3 working days for activation.

Alternatively you may follow these steps:

  1. Log in to Singpass using Face Verification

  2. Select 'Set up 2FA' icon

  3. Select 'Register SMS 2FA'

  4. Enter and verify your mobile number 


If you need on-site assistance, you can visit any Singpass counter in-person with your original NRIC/FIN card and mobile phone to set up SMS 2FA.

title: How do I suspend my Singpass account?

answer.body:
Step 1: Call Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533, and press “9” for 24-hour scam support

Step 2: Select “Suspend your account” by pressing “2”

Step 3: Enter the NRIC/FIN details of the account to be suspended

Step 4: Enter the SMS One-Time Password sent to the caller’s mobile number


Note: You can only suspend your Singpass account with this feature if you are a NRIC/FIN holder, and are calling Singpass Helpdesk using a Singapore-registered mobile number.

title: How do I set up Singpass app as a Singpass Foreign Account (SFA)?

answer.body:
1. Download the Singpass app from the App Store, Google Play Store or Huawei AppGallery.

  2. On the login screen, click on “Singpass Foreign Account (SFA)”.

  3. Enter your User ID that starts with Y. 

  4. Enter your email address that was registered in Singpass.

  5. Enter your Foreign ID (e.g., passport number).

  6. Select your Country of issuance for your Foreign ID.

  7. Click ‘Continue’.

  8. The One-Time password will be mailed to your email address that was registered in Singpass.

  9. Follow the instructions to setup the app accordingly.

title: How do I download and set up my Singpass app?

answer.body:
1. Download the Singpass app from the official app stores:

    • Official app stores:

      • For Apple iOS devices: App Store

      • For Android devices: Google Play Store

      • For Huawei devices: AppGallery

    • Check that the developer is Government Technology Agency before you download the app.


      Security advice 🔒

      • Always check that the developer is Government Technology Agency before you download the app.

      • Do not download government apps from third-party websites as you could infect your device with malware!

  2. Launch the Singpass app

    • Read the Terms & Privacy statement and tap “I Acknowledge”.
      Tap or swipe through the introduction screens for a quick overview of the Singpass app.


  3. Log in to your Singpass account

    Enter your Singpass ID and password.
    Your Singpass ID is your NRIC/FIN by default. If you forgot what it is, you can click here to retrieve it. 
    Forgot your Singpass account password? Click here to reset it.

    • Tip 💡

      • Don’t have a Singpass account? You can click here to register.

      • Singpass Foreign Account (SFA) user? Click here and follow the instructions in the link.


  4. Verify your identity

    • After successfully logging in to your Singpass account, you will be prompted to verify your identity.

      • For local users with a mobile number registered with Singpass:

        • Enter the SMS One-Time Password (OTP) sent to your mobile number.

        • Perform a face scan enabled by Singpass Face Verification to verify your identity.

      • For local users without a mobile number registered with Singpass:

        • A one-time PIN will be sent to your registered address

        • Enter the one-time PIN to verify your identity

      • For overseas users:

        • Perform a face scan enabled by Singpass Face Verification to verify your identity.


      Tip 💡

      • If you have deactivated your phone’s front-facing camera and would prefer not to turn it on for Singpass Face Verification, you can request for a PIN mailer instead. Click here to learn more.


  5. Check and confirm your identity details

    • Read the details, select the checkboxes and tap on "Continue".


  6. Create a six-digit app passcode

    • You will enter this passcode when accessing services using the Singpass app. It does not replace your Singpass account password.


  7. Set up biometric authentication (optional)

    • Depending on the available authentication function on your smartphone, you may choose to enable biometric authentication instead of typing your app passcode (e.g. fingerprint, face, etc.).



  8. Complete the setup

    • Follow the remaining instructions to enable notifications (if preferred) and learn how to log in using the Singpass app.


Your Singpass app is now ready for use

  • Try logging in to a service using your Singpass app by tapping or scanning the QR code.

  • You can also use the Digital IC on your app at government counters!

title: How do I sign with Singpass?

answer.body:
To digitally sign documents with your Singpass app, follow these steps:

  1. Use the ‘Scan’ feature on the app homepage to scan the Singpass QR code* on the document

  2. Match the reference code displayed on your app screen with that on the document. This ensures you are signing the correct document

  3. Authenticate using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode. You have successfully signed the document



Note: You will be prompted to add a signing certificate if you do not have one, or if your current certificate has expired. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the one-time set up.

title: I have lost my mobile device. What should I do?
body: Lost mobile device

answer.body:
Option 1
You can install the Singpass app on a new mobile device. Once you have activated the Singpass app on your new device, the Singpass app on your lost device will be automatically deactivated to ensure security.

Option 2
You may also choose to visit any of the Singpass counters in person, with your original NRIC or FIN card, to deactivate your Singpass app on the lost device.

title: What is Singpass?

answer.body: Singpass is Singapore citizens’ and residents' trusted digital identity for convenient and secure access to thousands of government and private sector services, online and in person

title: I have been logging in to services using Singpass 2FA. Why am I suddenly prompted to perform an additional security verification using Singpass Face Verification for logins?

answer.body:
Singpass is continuously strengthening its security measures as part of our efforts to combat evolving scams.


Singpass may require users to perform an additional security verification using Singpass Face Verification in some situations, such as when setting up your Singpass app or when for your protection, Singpass needs to confirm it is you logging in. This is an additional safeguard against unauthorised access to your Singpass account or services that require Singpass login.

title: Is it compulsory for me to use Singpass Face Verification?

answer.body:
We may in certain situations require you to use Singpass Face Verification where we deploy it as an additional means to guard against unauthorised access to your account. You may be required to do this when you log in to services on a new device or Internet browser, or for certain higher risk transactions.

Otherwise, if you do not wish to use Singpass Face Verification, you may continue to log in or transact using other authentication methods. For on-site assistance, you may visit any Singpass counters.

title: How do I set up Singpass Face Verification as my Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) method?

answer.body: Singpass Face Verification does not require any setup and is only available on desktop and mobile browsers. It requires the user to have a front-facing camera on their device when accessing digital services.

title: Is Singpass app free?

answer.body: Singpass app is free. All you need is a smartphone and Internet connection to access services enabled by Singpass, even when you are on-the-go or overseas.

title: In the Singpass app, my signing and authentication certificates now list the issuer as “Government Technology Agency” when it was previously “Assurity Trusted Solutions Pte Ltd”. Why is this so?

answer.body: Government Technology Agency will now oversee operations for the National Certificate Authority. Therefore, the change in issuer will reflect this.

title: Why should I suspend my Singpass account?

answer.body:
If your Singpass login details have been compromised, malicious actors may attempt to take over your Singpass account and misuse it for fraudulent activities.


In such situations, you should try to recover your Singpass account by taking these steps:


Reset password

  • Visit Singpass Portal

  • Select “Services” > “Reset password”

  • Enter your NRIC/FIN details

  • Complete an additional security verification using Singpass Face Verification

  • Set your new password


Update contact details to ensure you receive One-Time Passwords

  • Visit Singpass Portal

  • Click on "Use password login instead"

  • Log in to Singpass using your Singpass ID and new password

  • At the page prompting for 2FA, complete Singpass Face Verification

  • Select “My account” > “Update profile”

  • Update your mobile number and email address registered with Singpass


Note: You may be prompted to perform an additional security verification using Singpass Face Verification.


Regain control and access to Singpass app

  • Reinstall the Singpass app on your device. The Singpass app can only be installed on one device at a time. Reinstalling the app ensures that you regain control and access to it, should it be compromised by scammers.


If you are unable to recover your Singpass account, please call Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533 to suspend (temporarily disable) your Singpass account to prevent misuse.

title: I cannot log into my Singpass account when using agencies digital services. What do I do?

answer.body:
Please check that you have entered your Singpass ID and password correctly.


If your details are correct, try again after 5 minutes, as the mobile network may be congested.


Should the issue persist, please contact the agency (in-charge of that digital service) directly for assistance.

title: I encountered error 88-S11/ 88-E13/ 88-PE10/ 88-FV09 on the Singpass app. What should I do?

answer.body:
Please ensure you have updated to the latest version of Google Play Store or Huawei AppGallery.

To view your Play Store version, follow these steps:

  • Go to the Play Store app, tap on user account > “Settings” > “About”

  • Play Store must be at least version 40

  • Ensure “Play Protect certification” shows that “Device is certified”


If you have a Xiaomi device obtained from or manufactured for China:

  • Open Xiaomi GetApps

  • Search for Google Play Store

  • Update Google Play Store (on GetApps)

  • Re-open your Singpass app; the error code should be resolved. If the error persists, contact Singpass Helpdesk



If you have a vivo device obtained from or manufactured for China:

  • Open vivo Store

  • Search for Google Play Store

  • Update Google Play Store (on vivo Store)

  • Re-open your Singpass app; the error code should be resolved. If the issue persists, contact Singpass Helpdesk

title: What is Singpass 2FA?
body: Singpass 2FA

answer.body:
Singpass Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) helps to better protect your personal data. There are two steps in this security process.


If you are logging in to a digital service with your Singpass app:

  1. Scan the QR code on the login page using your Singpass app QR code scanner, if you are logging in from your desktop. Tap (touch and release) on the QR code, if you are logging in on a mobile device.

  2. Use your fingerprint (for selected smartphones), face (for selected smartphones) or enter your 6-digit passcode in the Singpass app.


If you are logging in to a digital service with your Singpass ID and password:

  1. Enter your Singpass ID and password.

  2. Select Face Verification to complete your 2FA, or enter a One-Time Password sent via SMS

title: Where can I get help for Singpass related matters?

answer.body:
Refer to our Instructional Guides for step-by-step instructions on how to register for a Singpass account and set up your 2FA.


There are dedicated Singpass counters island-wide to assist you on the following:

  • Register for Singpass account

  • Set up SMS 2FA

  • Reset Singpass password

  • Update account information, e.g. mobile number


If you are visiting a Singpass counter, please bring the following documents for verification purposes 🪪:


Singapore Citizens (SC) & Permanent Residents (PR)

1) For Singaporean (SC):

  • National Registration Identification Card (NRIC)

  • or Singapore Passport

  • or Singapore Driving Licence

  • or National Service IDs (11Bs) from SAF, SPF and SCDF


2) For National Service Personnel:

  • National Service IDs (11Bs) from SAF, SPF and SCDF

  • or Singapore Passport

  • or Singapore Driving License


3) For Permanent Residents (PR):

  • National Registration Identification Card (NRIC)

  • or Passport with Re-entry Permit or

  • or Singapore Driving Licence or

  • or National Service IDs from SAF, SPF and SCDF


Foreign Identity Number (FIN) Card Holders

1) For Employment Pass and Personalised Employment Pass Holders:

  • Employment Pass (EP) Card

  • or Personalised Pass (PEP) card

  • or Singapore Driving License


2) For S-Pass Holders

  • S-Pass Card

  • or Singapore Driving License


3) For Eligible Work permit (WP) holders

  • WP Card

  • or Singapore Driving License


4) For Dependent Pass Holders (of EP, PEP, EntrePass and S-Pass)

  • DP Pass card

  • or Singapore Driving Licence


5) For Long-Term Visit Pass-Plus (LTVP+) or Long-Term Visit Pass Holders

  • Visit Pass (PLUS) Card/Visit Pass Card

  • or Singapore Driving License

If your LTVP card is digital, show your digital card on ICA website or ICA app or FileSG or Singpass app.



6) EntrePass Holders

  • EntrePass card

  • or Approval-In-Principle letter (AIP) and Passport

  • or Singapore Driving License


7) Student Pass Holders

  • Student Pass card

  • or Singapore Driving License


Important notes:

Only original documents listed in the above table will be accepted at the Singpass counter for verification (Documents, such as In-Principle- Approval (IPA) Letter, police report for lost NRIC, ez-link card and senior citizen card, are not acceptable).

  • For Permanent Residents, they must either bring their passports that contain the Re-entry Permit (REP) endorsement / their passports with a copy of their REP print-out. With effect from 2 Jan 2009, ICA has ceased to issue REP endorsements in passports

  • For work pass holders who are applying for Singpass, they can only register for an account on the following Monday after their work pass has been issued.

You are strictly not allowed to authorise another person to request/reset your Singpass on your behalf.


Click here to locate the Singpass counter nearest to you.

title: My photo in my Singpass app Digital IC is not the latest. Why is this so?
body: Photo not updated

answer.body: If you have recently renewed your NRIC / passport / work pass with the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) / Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA), you may not see your updated photo on your Digital IC immediately. Processing time is required for the updated photo to be reflected in your Singpass app.

title: How can I retrieve the Foreign ID that is tied to my Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA)?

answer.body:
You can check with your Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) organisation to confirm which Foreign ID and email address have been registered. 


The SFA is only issued by SFA organisations. They are:

  1. Corppass

  2. Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS)

  3. Ministry of Law Singapore (MinLaw)

  4. Government Technology Agency - GoBusiness

title: How can I add my tertiary education achievements (e.g. Diploma, Degree, Masters) to my profile?

answer.body: The education data displayed currently covers only the National General Certificate of Education Ordinary “O”, Normal “N” and Advanced “A” levels. The Primary School Leaving Examination (PSLE) and other professional certificates are not included. We are working to include higher level certification details from local education institutions in the Singpass app profile. This is likely to be effected in the coming years.

title: I have suspended my Singpass account. How do I reactivate my account?
body: Reactivating a suspended account

answer.body:
To reactivate your account, please call Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533, and press “9” for 24-hour scam support. Select “Need other assistance” by pressing “3”, and our Helpdesk officer will assist you to reactivate your account.


After calling Singpass Helpdesk, I am unable to get through the first step to suspend my account. What should I do?


Please ensure that you are using a Singapore-registered mobile number for this call. In addition, if you have exceeded the maximum number of tries per day, you will not be able to proceed.

title: What services can a Singpass Foreign user Account access?

answer.body:
A Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) for Foreign ID users can only be used to access digital services provided by SFA organisations i.e. Corppass, IRAS, MinLaw, GovTech (GoBusiness).


It is unlike a Singpass account for NRIC/FIN users, which can be used to access government and selected private sector digital services in Singapore.

title: I have received an SMS OTP from Singpass, but I did not request for it. What do I do?

answer.body:
There is a chance that someone has your Singpass ID and password, and is trying to log into your account. However, with Singpass 2FA, your account is protected. The hacker needs to have your mobile phone to perform transactions involving sensitive data.

Nonetheless, we strongly advise you to take the following actions:

  • Reset your Singpass password immediately to prevent unauthorised access to your account.

  • Call Singpass Helpdesk at +65 6335 3533 and press “9” for 24-hour scam support to secure your account

  • Lodge a police report at any Neighbourhood Centre/Post, or via the Electronic Police Centre website.

title: I think I got scammed / I suspect my account has been compromised. How can I recover my account?
body: Reporting a scam or account compromised

answer.body:
Follow these steps to recover your account:

1) Reset your password using Singpass Face Verification (Refer to the step-by-step guide here).


2) Log in to Singpass portal using your new password, followed by Singpass Face Verification.


3) Select “Update profile” to update your mobile number and email address. You will be prompted to enter the OTP sent to your newly entered mobile number and email address.


4) Reinstall the Singpass app on your device. (Refer to the step-by-step guide here). This ensures that only you have access to your Singpass app. 


Alternatively, you can also choose to suspend your Singpass account via these steps. This means you will not be able to log in to your Singpass account. You can unsuspend your Singpass account through the Singpass Helpdesk.


For further assistance, call Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533 and press “9” for 24-hour scam support. You should also lodge a police report.

title: Do I need an Internet connection or mobile data to access Singpass and Singpass app?

answer.body: You will require an Internet connection or mobile data when using Singpass to access digital services.

title: I do not have a Singapore-registered mobile number. Can I set up SMS 2FA using an overseas mobile number?

answer.body: Only Singapore-registered mobile numbers can be used to register for SMS 2FA. If you are travelling or living overseas, please use the Singpass app or Face Verification as 2FA instead to access government digital services.

title: What is the format of the Singpass ID issued to foreign users?

answer.body: The Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) ID format is a 7-digit number prefixed by Y and ending with an alphabet. (E.g. Y1234567A).

title: I can't seem to log in to certain digital services using Singpass app despite having set it up. Why is this so?

answer.body:
When logging in through a web browser, check that your browser allows Singpass app to automatically launch when you tap on the QR code.


For Android users

  • Go to "Settings" > "Apps" > select "Singpass app" > "Set as default". Under the "App Links" section, choose "In this app" under "Go to supported URLs".

  • For best experience, please use Google Chrome as your web browser.


For iOS users

  • Tap and hold on the QR code on the Singpass login page, then select "Open in Singpass app". If this option isn't available, please wait for an hour before trying again or reinstall the app thereafter.

  • For best experience, please use Safari as your web browser.


You may also log in to some Government digital services from the Singpass app.

title: How do I print my CPF contribution history?

answer.body: Please log in to the CPF Portal to retrieve and print your CPF statements.

title: I have not registered my mobile number with Singpass (i.e. I do not have SMS FA). How can I set up Singpass app on my mobile device?

answer.body:
If you have not set up your 2FA, you can still set up the Singpass app easily. Simply follow these steps:


  1. Download the Singpass app from the official app stores

    • For Apple iOS devices: App store

    • For Android devices: Google Play Store

    • For Huawei devices: AppGallery

  2. Check that the developer is Government Technology Agency before you download the app

  3. Launch the app and enter your Singpass ID and password

  4. Get an activation PIN by postal mail

    • A one-time PIN will be sent to your registered address

    • After you receive the PIN, enter the one-time PIN to verify your identity

title: How do I check if I have successfully set up my Singpass 2FA?
body: Check if Singpass 2FA has been set up

answer.body: Log in to your account at Singpass Portal > Under the 'My account' drop-down menu at the top > Select 'Manage 2FA'. You can view your 2FA status and choose to change your preferred mode of verification (SMS 2FA, Singpass app).

title: I am unable to access Singpass app's QR code scanner. What should I do?

answer.body:
You need to grant Singpass app access to your device's camera function to access Singpass app's QR code scanner. Go to your devices 'Settings' menu to enable Singpass app access to your device's camera function, and try again.

If the matter persists, QR code scanning may be incompatible with your device, operating system or browser. You may continue to log in using Singpass ID and password, followed by entering your SMS One-Time Password or through Face Verification.

title: I received an error message saying that the mobile number I provided is already registered and cannot be used for Singpass with my account. What should I do?
body: Mobile number already registered

answer.body:
Unless with your explicit consent in the case of the Multi-User SMS 2FA, only one mobile number can be registered to one Singpass account at any time for security reasons. The error message indicates that your number may have been registered by another user.

If you want to use this mobile number for your Singpass account, please contact us.

title: I have not used Singpass for a while. Why do I have to reset my password?

answer.body:
If you have not logged in to your Singpass account for a prolonged period of time, your account will be listed as dormant. This is part of the security measures in place to protect users' account and personal data.

To re-instate your account, simply visit the Singpass Portal and reset your Singpass password.

title: What happens when I forget to log out of a digital service after accessing it via Singpass app?

answer.body:
If you forget to log out of a digital service from your Internet browser, you will automatically be logged out of the digital service after a period of inactivity.

However, you are encouraged to always log out of the digital service directly from the Internet browser once the transaction is completed.

title: What is Sign with Singpass?
body: Sign with Singpass

answer.body:
Sign with Singpass allows Singpass users to digitally sign documents such as contracts and agreements with signing certificates issued by the National Certification Authority contained in the Singpass app.


To perform digital signing, users need to scan the Singpass QR code on the intended document, match the on-screen reference code and authenticate using their fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode.

title: Does the Digital IC replace my physical NRIC, FIN or long-term pass card?

answer.body:
The Digital IC is a feature in your Singpass app that displays your name, NRIC number/FIN, photo, and other details that are on your physical NRIC/ long-term pass card.

You can choose to use the Digital IC in place of your physical NRIC/ long-term pass card, as most Government agencies accept its use. Businesses are also encouraged to accept the Digital IC as an alternative to the physical NRIC or long-term pass card for identity verification.

You may be required to produce your physical NRIC/ long-term pass card, if required by law in some specific situations, or if the agency or business requires it for specific transactions. Please refer to the list of government agency services that may still require physical identification cards to be presented here.


If you lose your physical NRIC/ long-term pass card issued by the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA)/ Ministry of Manpower (MOM), you must report the loss and apply for a new card within 14 days for the NRIC and 7 days for the long-term pass card.

title: Contact Information

answer.body:
If you are unable to find the information you need in this FAQ, you may reach out to us through these methods:

Call us 📞

Contact our Singpass Helpdesk at +65 6335 3533

Scam support (available 24/7 - press "9" after dialling in)


For General Enquiries :

Operating Hours :

  • Mondays to Fridays: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM

  • Closed on Saturdays, Sundays, and Public Holidays

  • Our anti-scam hotline will remain available 24/7


Feedback form ✉️

Please contact us here


Find a Singpass counter 🏛️

Click here to find a Singpass counter nearest to you

If you are visiting a Singpass counter, click here to find the documents you need to bring for verification purposes.

title: After setting up Singpass app, do I still need my SMS-OTP or Face Verification?
body: SMS or Face Verification after set up

answer.body:
With Singpass app, you can log in to digital services using your face, fingerprint or six-digit passcode.


You will only have to enter your SMS One-Time Password or perform Face Verification when setting up the Singpass app on a new device.

title: What is Singpass app?

answer.body:
Singpass app is a mobile application that is available on iOS, Android and Huawei* operating systems.
You can use the Singpass app as a Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) method to conveniently access digital services using your fingerprint, face or a six-digit passcode.


With the app, you can also access frequently-used services through the shortcuts, flash your Digital IC, digitally sign documents, view your important information, and read notifications from government agencies.More features will be added to the app so keep your app updated!


Minimum Operating System (OS) Requirements

  1. The Singpass app is compatible with operating systems versions iOS 13.0, Android 8.0 and above.

  2. *We are aware of the new HarmonyOS NEXT operating system for Huawei mobile devices. Our team is currently evaluating its potential compatibility and support with the Singpass app.


This ensures the security of data accessed via Singpass when Singpass app users transact online. As with all digital applications and services, system updates protect users from evolving security threats such as malware. Older systems are not equipped to defend against newer and more sophisticated threats. System updates also provide bug fixes and user interface (UI) improvements.

title: I am unable to set up Singpass app using my existing 2FA modes, (i.e. SMS-OTP). How else can I set up Singpass app?
body: Unable to use existing 2FA modes to set up Singpass app

answer.body:
If you are unable to set up Singpass app using your existing 2FA modes, you can request for a PIN mailer to be sent to your mailing address that is registered with the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority of Singapore (ICA).


Follow these steps:


  1. Download Singpass app from the official app stores.

  2. Open the app and log in with your Singpass ID and Password.

  3. At the screen prompting for an OTP (see sample below), scroll down and click on the hyperlink in the sentence 'If you are not able to complete setting up Singpass app with your existing 2FA, click here for alternative options.'

  4. Select 'Mail a PIN to my address'.


A PIN mailer will be sent to your registered mailing address within 10 working days (subject to overseas postal services and delays). Follow the instructions in the PIN mailer to complete the app setup, and you're done!

Alternatively, you can set up Singpass app using Face Verification.

title: I reside overseas and the OneKey Token was my only 2FA method. What are my alternatives if I need to access digital services that require Singpass 2FA?
body: Alternatives to OneKey token for Singaporeans overseas

answer.body:
For seamless access to digital services, we highly encourage users to switch to the Singpass app.

To set up your Singpass app, you can request for a PIN mailer to be sent to your mailing address registered with the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority of Singapore (ICA). To do so:

  1. Download Singpass app from the official app stores.

  2. Launch the app and log in with your Singpass ID and password.

  3. At the screen prompting for an OTP, scroll down and click on the hyperlink in the sentence If you are not able to complete setting up Singpass app with your existing 2FA, click here for alternative options.

  4. Select 'Mail a PIN to my address'.


A PIN mailer will be sent to your registered mailing address within 10 working days (subject to overseas postal operations and delays). Follow the instructions in the PIN mailer to complete the app setup.

Alternatively, you can set up Singpass app using Face Verification (only available on browsers of smart devices with camera).


If you do not have a smartphone, you may use Singpass Face Verification as your 2FA.


For Face Verification, simply log in to any government digital service with your Singpass ID and password. Select Face Verification at the next step and follow the instructions on your screen to scan your face. This service works on a computer that is equipped with a web camera or a mobile device with a front-facing camera.

If you have a locally-registered mobile number (starting with +65), you may also register for SMS 2FA on Singpass Portal


To use SMS 2FA, simply log in with your Singpass ID and password, followed by a One-Time Password (OTP) sent via SMS to your mobile phone.

title: What precaution should I take if I want to use fingerprint authentication / face recognition for my Singpass app?
body: Precautions to take with biometrics

answer.body:
Your Singpass account contains sensitive personal information, and is intended as a means of verification and authentication of your identity online.


When using Singpass app, you are reminded to only register your own fingerprint or face on your smartphone, and not to share your six-digit passcode with other individuals.


This is to maintain the confidentiality, safekeeping and security of your Singpass account and the transactions conducted through it.

title: What should I do if I face difficulty logging into a government mobile app with Singpass?

answer.body:
Here are some ways you can troubleshoot:


  1. Ensure your Internet connection is stable

  2. Relaunch the app and try to log in again

  3. Make sure your device operating system and app are updated to the latest version

  4. Check that your device date-time setting is set to “Automatic”

  5. Ensure that you did not block all cookies in your browser settings

  6. Use Safari (version 16 and above) or Chrome (version 114 and above) as your default browser

  7. If you are using Firefox browser, check that you have enabled the opening of links in apps in your browser settings


Please note that Singpass may not work on older web browser versions and users are advised to upgrade to the latest versions. Outdated web browsers, where security updates have been discontinued by the product developers, may pose security risks to your Singpass account.

title: If I have signed a document successfully using Sign with Singpass, do I still need to sign that same document in hardcopy?

answer.body: It is not necessary to sign a document in hardcopy if you have successfully signed with Singpass. If you are executing a contract, please take care to ensure that your contract can be executed electronically.

title: What are the different authentication methods to log in to Singpass?

answer.body:
You may log in by scanning the QR code on the login page with your Singpass app (or tapping on the QR code if you are logging in on a mobile browser), or by entering your Singpass ID and password.

If you are using your Singpass ID and password, you will be prompted to enter a SMS One-Time Password or do Face Verification for 2FA.

title: I have just obtained a new pass issued by MOM. I used it to apply for Singpass, but encountered the error message 'You have entered an invalid Name/ Singpass ID/ Date of Issue'. Why is this so?
body: Error with new pass issued by MOM

answer.body: Your new records with MOM may take some time to be updated in the Singpass system. Please try again after 24 hours.

title: My Work Permit has expired/ I have cancelled my Work Permit. Can I still use Singpass to access services?
body: Expired or cancelled Work Permit

answer.body: Your Singpass account is valid for 3 months from your Work Permit expiry or cancellation date. You can continue to access services with Singpass during the 3-month grace period, but not your Myinfo data. After which, your Singpass account will be deactivated.

title: What is the definition of Foreign Users?

answer.body:
Foreign users are individuals who do not have a Singapore Government-issued ID.

These individuals may be issued a Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) to perform transactions in Singapore.

title: I am relocating overseas. Can I use my overseas mobile number for Singpass SMS 2FA?
body: Using overseas mobile number for SMS 2FA

answer.body: Only Singapore-registered mobile numbers can be used to register for SMS 2FA. If you are travelling or living overseas, please use the Singpass app or Face Verification as 2FA instead to access government digital services.

title: Where would my one-time Singpass password (PIN mailer) be sent to?

answer.body:
Your one-time Singpass password will be mailed to your address registered with the Government. It will arrive within 3 working days for local address and 10 working days for overseas address (depending on the overseas postal service). If you are holding a work pass issued by MOM, the registered address will be your company’s address.



To update residential address:

title: Why is my NRIC/FIN used as my default Singpass User ID?

answer.body:
Your NRIC/FIN is used as your default Singpass User ID because it is a unique identifier and easy for you to remember. This simplifies the login process while ensuring security through the use of a password you have created.


How is my NRIC/FIN protected?

  • Your Singpass account is secured by your password, which is private and known only to you. Even if someone knows your User ID, they cannot access your account without the password.

  • Additional layers of protection, such as Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) and additional security verification for sensitive transactions, add further security to your account.


What can I do if I’m concerned about using my NRIC/FIN as my Singpass User ID?

If you do not want to use your NRIC/FIN as your Singpass User ID, you can customise it to something more private and unique. Here’s how:


  1. Log in to your account on the Singpass Portal.

  2. Select the 'Update Profile' icon. 

3. Select the 'Change Singpass ID’' button next to your current Singpass ID.

4. Choose a new Singpass User ID that is not easy to guess and keep it private.



How can I keep my Singpass account secure?

  • Keep your password and app passcode private and do not share them with anyone.

  • Use a strong password that combines letters, numbers, and special characters.

  • Be cautious of phishing attempts. Check that the website domain is singpass.gov.sg before entering your Singpass credentials.

title: Is digital signing using Sign with Singpass secure?

answer.body:
Using signing certificates issued by the National Certification Authority, Sign with Singpass produces digital signatures that are regarded as Secure Electronic Signatures (SES) under Singapore's Electronic Transactions Act.


The digital signature is identifiable and cryptographically linked to the signer, providing higher assurance of the authenticity and integrity of the signed documents. This differs from electronic signatures generally, which may require additional supporting evidence and audit trails to prove their authenticity.


The signed documents are also tamper-proof, such that if the electronic record is altered, the system will alert the user that the signature is invalid. Subsequent changes to the signed document are detectable and credentials are uniquely linked and identifiable to the signers.

title: Am I eligible for a Myinfo profile?

answer.body: All Singpass users will have a profile. Foreigners who have a valid permit (e.g. work permit / employment pass) can also register for Singpass and have their own profile.

title: How do I update my profile data?

answer.body:
These data are official records retrieved from government sources and it reflects what has been registered with the government. Should any information be incorrect, please contact the relevant agency to update the respective data.


Please note that it will normally take 1-3 working days for your profile to reflect the updated data after verification by the relevant agency.

title: How do I use Login Shortcuts?

answer.body:
1. Launch Singpass app and select the digital service you want to access

  2. Confirm your login request

  3. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode

  4. Done! You will be re-directed to the digital service in your mobile Internet browser


To protect your account, please log out of the digital service in your Internet browser when your transaction is completed. Returning to Singpass app does not automatically log you out of the digital service.

title: I am an overseas user. How can I set up Singpass app on my mobile device?
body: Setting up your Singpass app overseas

answer.body:
If you already have 2FA (i.e. SMS-2FA) set up:

  1. Download the Singpass app from the official app store links below: (Check that the app developer is "Government Technology Agency")

    • For Apple iOS devices: App store

    • For Android devices: Google Play Store

    • For Huawei devices: AppGallery


  2. Open the app and complete a one-time setup.

    • You will need to verify your identity using an OTP sent via SMS, and Face Verification to activate the app.


If you do not have 2FA (i.e. SMS-2FA) set up:

  1. Download Singpass app from the official app stores.

    • Check that the app developer is "Government Technology Agency".

  2. Verification

    • A PIN mailer will be sent to your registered mailing address within 10 working days (depending on overseas postal services). Follow the instructions in the PIN mailer to complete the app setup, and you're done!


Note: All Singpass correspondence will be sent to your mailing address registered with the Immigrations and Checkpoints Authority of Singapore (ICA).

title: The OneKey token was my only 2FA. How do I set up other 2FA methods now?
body: Setting up another 2FA method to replace OneKey token

answer.body:
We encourage you to set up other 2FA methods as soon as possible for seamless access. Choose one of the following options today: 


Singpass app
If you have a smartphone, you may download the Singpass app to log in using your fingerprint , face or a six-digit passcode.  


Download the app from the Apple App Store, Huawei App Gallery or Google Play Store. 

Please follow our Singpass Guides on how to set up your Singpass app. 


Face Verification
This feature allows you to log in to a digital service with your Singpass ID and password, followed by scanning your face on a computer with a web camera, or a smartphone with a front-facing camera on your mobile web browser.


Simply select Face Verification when prompted for your 2FA authentication.


SMS 2FA
If you have a mobile phone that cannot download apps, you may log in to Singpass to set up your SMS 2FA.


With this, you can use the SMS One-Time Password (OTP) sent to your mobile number to log into Singpass. Only Singapore-registered mobile numbers may be used for this. 

 

Multi-User SMS 2FA 

If a family member is helping you with your transactions, you can give your one-time explicit consent to link your Singpass account to his/her mobile number for the purpose of receiving the SMS-OTP.


Both parties are required to activate this option at any of the Singpass Counters islandwide. If you have difficulties being physically present, please contact our Singpass Helpdesk here.

title: What are the different 2FA options that I can choose from? Can I have more than one mode of 2FA?

answer.body:
There are several 2FA options that you can choose from depending on your preference.


  • Singpass app

    • If you have a smartphone, you may download the Singpass app to log in using your fingerprint, face or a 6-digit passcode. Download the Singpass app only from official app stores (i.e. Apple App Store, Google Play Store and Huawei App Gallery).


  • Face Verification

    • This feature allows you to log in by entering your Singpass ID and password, followed by scanning your face on a computer with a web camera, or a smartphone with a front-facing camera.


  • SMS 2FA

    • If you have a mobile phone that cannot download apps, you may log in to  Singpass Portal to set up your SMS 2FA. With this, you can use the SMS One-Time Password (OTP) sent to your mobile number to log into Singpass. Only Singapore-registered mobile numbers may be used for this.


  • Multi-User SMS 2FA

    • If a family member is helping you with your transactions, you can give your one-time explicit consent to link your Singpass account to his/her mobile number for the purpose of receiving the SMS-OTP. Both parties are required to activate this option at any of the Singpass counters islandwide.

title: After calling Singpass Helpdesk, I am unable to get through the first step to suspend my account. What should I do?
body: Unable to suspend after calling helpdesk

answer.body: Please ensure that you are using a Singapore-registered mobile number for this call. In addition, if you have exceeded the maximum number of tries per day, you will not be able to proceed.

title: Does Singpass collect biometric data during the use of Singpass Face Verification?
body: Collection of biometric data during Face Verification

answer.body:
Yes. Your facial data is collected and used for purposes such as authenticating your identity and improving Singpass Face Verification.


Unless prohibited by law, facial data may be:

  • captured by relying parties approved by us to use Singpass Face Verification;

  • shared with our service providers in connection with the provision of Singpass Face Verification to you; or

  • shared with government agencies to serve you in the most efficient and effective way or for the discharge of public functions.


Facial data is retained to analyse and improve Singpass Face Verification. This data retained is encrypted when stored and protected with tamper-evident logging. We delete data that is no longer required, unless we are legally required to retain such data.

title: Why is my Singpass Face Verification unsuccessful?

answer.body:
There may be several possible reasons for this. For ways to improve the success of Face Verification, you should ensure that:

  1. Your face is not covered

  2. You keep still while scanning is in progress

  3. Your environment is not too dark

  4. There is no strong lighting in the background

  5. You use a minimum resolution of 2 megapixels for the camera


If you are unable to complete the Singpass Face Verification, please contact us.

title: Can my Digital IC on the Singpass app be used to reset my Singpass account password?

answer.body: You will need to enter the date of issuance of your identity card/long term pass to reset your Singpass password online.

title: The Singpass Digital IC is displayed on the homepage of my app. Is this safe? What happens if I lose my phone?

answer.body:
The Digital IC on the Singpass app homepage displays minimal information (e.g., partial NRIC number/FIN) that are masked by default to protect your privacy. You are required to verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode to view your full NRIC number/FIN, barcode and more details on your Digital IC.

You are also advised to password protect your device and set up only your own biometric data for secure access. Should you misplace your device, you may choose to install the app on another device to automatically deactivate it on the lost device or contact Singpass Helpdesk for assistance.

The Integrated Family Application Management System (iFAMS) is a comprehensive end-to-end system which deals predominantly with applications for family protection and maintenance order cases brought before the Family Justice Courts (FJC). It is a paperless system and developed as a base for family related applications which can cater for future expansion to include other family court related applications. iFAMS covers electronic case filing, tracking, workflow routing, case hearing and generation of electronic letters, Court Orders and statistical reports.
