title: How do I use Singpass app to access digital services?

answer.body:
On desktop:

  1. Scan the QR code on the login page using Singpass app's QR code scanner

  2. Confirm your login request

  3. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode, and you're in!


On mobile device:

  1. Tap (touch and release) on the QR code on the login page to launch the app

  2. Confirm your login request

  3. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode, and you're in!

title: I am an Employment Pass/Work Permit holder but my occupation is inaccurately reflected on my profile. How do I amend it?
body: Occupation inaccurately reflected

answer.body:
Your employer will need to inform the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) of any changes in your employment details via the iSubmit function here. Please select request type 'Work Pass Application Matters (Excluding Work Permit)' if you are an S Pass or Employment Pass holder when submitting the document.


For work permit holder, your employer needs to fill in the 'Change Work Permit holder's occupation' form and submit it through request type 'Amendment of Information/Particulars for Foreign Workers and Foreign Domestic Workers' here.


Your profile will reflect the updated employment details after MOM has approved the amendment.

title: I am a Singpass Foreign Account (SFA) holder. Can I suspend my Singpass account through this self-service feature?
body: Suspending Singpass Foreign user Account

answer.body: This feature is not available to SFA users. Please call the Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533, and press “9” for 24-hour scam support. Select “Need other assistance” by pressing “3”, and our helpdesk officer will assist you to suspend your account.

title: As a secondary user, how can I change my primary mobile number to someone else?
body: Changing primary mobile number as a secondary user

answer.body:
You may visit any of the Singpass counters islandwide with the new primary user or contact us to schedule a video call if you have difficulty visiting a Singpass counter.

The system will automatically override the mobile number with the new number once the process is complete.

title: What is Multi-User SMS 2FA?

answer.body:
Family or trusted care support


We recognise that there might be a group of users without personal mobile smartphones and/or computers. These users may rely on a trusted family member or caregiver to help transact digitally with the Government.

As such, this feature was created to allow users to link their account to another persons mobile number for the sole purpose of the latter receiving SMS One-Time Passwords (OTP) on behalf of the former. The primary user of the mobile number will receive the secondary users SMS-OTP as a Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) when the secondary user is making transactions that involve more sensitive data.

Primary users will not be able to see what the secondary user is transacting on nor receive any government-linked mailers or notifications on behalf of the secondary user.


What type of services can I expect with Multi-User SMS 2FA?

This feature is offered as an alternative Two-Factor Authentication for citizens to transact using their Singpass account. It provides access to any government digital services and services of industry partners which require Singpass login.


Is Multi-User SMS 2FA only for family members to use?

This alternative 2FA method seeks to support older, or less tech-savvy Singpass users who require assistance transacting with the Government. They may be assisted by a trusted caregiver who may or may not be a family member.

title: Without the need to enter my Singpass ID and password, is Singpass app considered to be only one-factor authentication?
body: How is Singpass app a mode of 2FA?

answer.body:
Singpass app is a mode of two-factor authentication (2FA). It involves:


  1. The app that is in your mobile phone (what you have), and

  2. Your biometrics (what you are) such as fingerprint or face, or six-digit passcode (what you know)


To protect your account, please be reminded to only register your own fingerprint (for selected smartphones), or face (for selected smartphones) on your smartphone, and not to share your 6-digit passcode with other individuals.

There are also several layers of security measures in place. For example, when the app detects potential security breach or presence of malicious software on your mobile device, it will not allow you to use the app on that device.

title: What are the requirements for a Singpass password?

answer.body:
Having a strong password is essential to keeping your Singpass account safe.

Your Singpass password should meet the following criteria:


  • Consist of 8 to 24 alphanumeric characters, with at least 1 letter and 1 number. It should preferably contain capital letters and symbols. Special characters, excluding space, can be used (e.g. hgu%7$)

  • Cannot be the same as any of the past five passwords used

  • Cannot be the same as your Singpass ID, or contain the numeric values of your NRIC / FIN and the word "pass" or "pwd" (e.g. 12345Pwd, Password1, pass1234, S1234567)


You are advised not to use a password that can be easily guessed, such as your contact number, date of birth, identity card number or family member's name.

title: Why is the photograph in my Singpass Digital IC different from my physical NRIC card?
body: Photo is different from physical NRIC

answer.body:
The Singpass Digital IC is a form of digital identification designed for convenient identity verification on the go.


To enable it to be used as an alternative to the physical NRIC, the Digital IC is kept up-to-date by displaying the most recent information available. This includes the latest photograph you have provided to the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority of Singapore (ICA), e.g. when you renewed your passport or re-registered your NRIC. The retrieval of the latest photograph from ICA’s records for display on the Singpass Digital IC applies to all Singpass users.


The updated photograph in the app helps counter officers verify your identity more accurately, improving overall security for users.

title: An organisation has requested for a screenshot of my Singpass Digital IC. Is this allowed?
body: Are requests for screenshots allowed?

answer.body:
The Singpass Digital IC is an alternative for a user to present his identity credentials for in-person services, but it is not meant to be screen captured for record keeping due to security reasons.

If personal data needs to be collected, agencies or businesses should use the Singpass Verify or Myinfo services to retrieve the data with the user's consent. Alternatively, agencies or businesses may record the information displayed on the Digital IC into their own systems. The collection and use of data are subject to Public Sector (Governance) Act or Personal Data Protection Act where applicable.

title: When can I use the Digital IC?

answer.body:
You can use the Digital IC when a Government agency needs to verify your identity by checking your identity credentials, such as name, NRIC number and photograph (in compliance with the Personal Data Protection Act). For example, you may present your Digital IC for counter services or tap on "Show barcode" to scan your NRIC/FIN barcode at kiosks, such as those at libraries and SingHealth polyclinics. To ensure security, you will need to verify yourself using your fingerprint, face or passcode when accessing details on your Digital IC.

There may be a small number of situations where the physical identity card (e.g. NRIC or long-term pass card) is specifically required. Please refer to the exception list here.

 

Businesses are also encouraged to accept the Digital IC as an alternative to physical NRIC or long-term pass card for identity verification, though we note that private organisations have their separate operational considerations and may need time to accept and onboard new verification methods.

title: Why is my Singpass app profile inactive and how can I reactivate it?

answer.body:
There are several reasons why your profile may be inactive:

  1. Your Singpass account is no longer valid;

  2. Your employment pass or work permit is no longer valid; or

  3. Your Singpass profile has been inactivated by the system administrator due to security and data privacy concerns.

title: My registered address is not auto-filled on the digital service form. What should I do?

answer.body:
If you are a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident, please update your registered address with ICA here.  


If you are holding an LTVP issued by ICA, please update your registered address with ICA here.


If you are holding an STP issued by ICA, please approach your educational institution to update your registered address with ICA.


If you are holding an MOM-issued pass, please update your registered address with MOM here.

title: If I log in to a private sector service using Singpass, will the company have access to all my information?

answer.body:
Singpass is used by organisations to only verify the identity of individual users during the login process.

If any of your personal information is required by the organisation, you will be prompted with a screen, asking for your consent. You will need to give your consent before your information will be shared.

title: I do not own a mobile phone. What are the alternatives to the OneKey token?
body: Alternatives to OneKey token if i don't have a mobile phone

answer.body:
From 1 April 2021, if you need to perform logins and transactions that require Singpass, please use the Singpass app, SMS 2FA or Face Verification.


Alternatively, you may wish to visit any of the Singpass counters islandwide or the respective agencies to perform your transactions over the counter. You may contact the respective agencies to enquire. 


You may also access services using Singpass SMS 2FA and Face Verification:

For SMS 2FA, all you need to do is enter your Singpass ID and password, followed by a One-Time Password (OTP) sent via SMS to your mobile number. If you have not set up SMS 2FA, please follow the instructional guide to register for your SMS 2FA.


For Face Verification, simply log in to any government digital service with your Singpass ID and password. Select Face Verification at the next step and follow the instructions on your screen to scan your face. This service works on a computer that is equipped with a web camera.

title: Can I set up SMS 2FA only?

answer.body: You can choose to set up SMS 2FA, Singpass app, or use Face Verification which does not require additional setup.

title: How long is my Singpass password valid, and where can I find more information about it?

answer.body:
Your Singpass password is valid for 2 years. This helps keep your Singpass account safe by making sure you update the password regularly, which protects you from hackers and keeps your information secure.


Singpass website

When you log in with an expired password, you will be prompted to set a new Singpass password.

If you want to check your Singpass account password validity details, you can log in to the Singpass website to view them.

(www.singpass.gov.sg > Log in)

Singpass app

When you log in with an expired password, you will be prompted to set a new Singpass password.

title: How can I see which organisations I have shared my data with?

answer.body:
To view your Myinfo transaction history, simply follow these steps:

  1. Launch the Singpass app

  2. Tap on the Settings menu (gear icon) at the top right corner

  3. Select "Past transactions", followed by "Myinfo transaction history"

  4. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode

  5. View the list of organisations you have shared your data with

title: What is Myinfo?

answer.body:
Myinfo is a service that allows Singpass users to manage their personal data and pre-fill forms, with their consent, in digital services transactions. This includes data that is retrieved across participating government agencies.


This means that users need only provide personal data once to the digital service instead of repeatedly providing data for every online transaction. Users can also view their personal data profile on their Singpass app.


Benefits:

  • No more repetitive filling of your personal information for multiple online transactions

  • Reduce the incidence of mistakes as a result of human error

  • Do away with the need for physical documents as verification to complete transactions

title: Can I use other QR code scanner apps to log in to government digital services?

answer.body: No, you can only use Singpass app's QR code scanner to log in. This is one of the security measures in place to better protect your Singpass account and personal information.

title: I was prompted to perform an additional verification during setup of my Singpass app. This was not required previously. Why is there a need for this additional step?
body: Additional verification during set up

answer.body:
Singpass is continuously updating its threat detection and login security as part of our efforts to combat evolving scams. The setup process of the Singpass app is critical as it ties the user’s identity to the app for subsequent logins.

From 10 October 2022, users may be required to perform a face scan enabled by Singpass Face Verification during app setup as an additional measure to mitigate scams and prevent unauthorised access to users’ Singpass account.

title: I have an IRAS Unique Account (IRAS-UA) account. I received an email to activate a Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA). What should I do?
body: IRAS Unique Account (IRAS UA)

answer.body:
Please follow the instructions in the email to activate your SFA. After activation, Singpass will link your IRAS-UA account to your SFA and you will be able to access both IRAS-UA and the other digital services with your SFA.
 

Note: Ensure that the SFA created for you contains the same personal details (Foreign ID and name) as your IRAS-UA to use the Singpass app as your login method.

title: What if I have multiple Foreign ID documents?

answer.body: You should use the same Foreign ID document (e.g. passport number or national identity card number) to register for your Singpass Foreign user Account.

title: Why do I have to perform a one-time account update upon logging in?
body: One time account update

answer.body:
This is to better protect your Singpass account. You need to provide and verify your personal details, and select your preferred mode of contact (email or mobile number) to receive prompt notifications when there are changes made to your account details.

By registering your mobile number during the one-time account update, you will be instantly activated for SMS 2FA. Click here to find out more about setting up SMS 2FA.

title: I have only set up my OneKey Token previously. How can I set up my SMS 2FA now?

answer.body:
To set up SMS 2FA:

  1. Log into Singpass using Face Verification

  2. Select 'Set up 2FA' icon

  3. Select 'Register SMS 2FA'

  4. Enter and verify your mobile number

title: What if the secondary user is unable to provide consent as he/she has lost mental capacity?
body: Secondary user has lost of mental capacity

answer.body:
Primary users are required to either be a Donee with Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or be a Court-Appointed Deputy for the secondary to be eligible to apply for this feature.

Primary users can submit their application via the links below:

  • Donees with LPA: [https://go.gov.sg/multi-user-donee]

  • Deputies with a Court Order: [https://go.gov.sg/multi-user-deputy]

title: The system indicates that ‘the One-Time Password (OTP) has expired’. What should I do?

answer.body: If you did not receive your One-Time Password (OTP) within one minute, select ‘Resend OTP’ to request a new OTP.

title: I did not receive a One-Time Password after multiple requests. What should I do?

answer.body: Please try again after 5 minutes, as the mobile network may be congested. If you are still unable to receive One-Time Passwords, please contact Singpass Helpdesk here.

title: If my signing and authentication certificates still list “Assurity Trusted Solution Pte Ltd”, does this mean my certificates are invalid?

answer.body: The certificate renewal will be rolled out in phases for users to transition from certificates issued by Assurity Trusted Solutions Pte Ltd to those issued by Government Technology Agency. Throughout the transition phase, transactions completed using Assurity Trusted Solutions Pte Ltd’ certificates will still valid.

title: How do I access the Digital IC?

answer.body:
To view your Digital IC,

  1. Launch the Singpass app

  2. Tap on the Digital IC card

  3. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode. Even after successful authentication, personal details that are normally found in the physical IC are masked by default. Click on Show details to view full details.


You can also tap on the eye icon to unmask the NRIC number/FIN and tap on "Show barcode" to scan your NRIC/FIN barcode at kiosks, such as those at libraries and SingHealth polyclinics.

title: How can I sign up for the Multi-user SMS 2FA service?

answer.body:
Both the primary and secondary users of the mobile number are required to present their NRIC/FIN to verify their identities and consent to the terms of the arrangement at any of the Singpass counters islandwide to activate this option. A video call can be arranged with the Singpass Helpdesk for users who are not able to visit our Singpass counters.

Primary users can link their mobile number with up to six (6) secondary users. However, as a security feature, the secondary users account can only be linked to one mobile user at any one time.

This arrangement of having both parties present to verify their identities and consent to the terms of the Multi-User SMS 2FA setup is necessary to safeguard the interest of our users and to avoid any potential misuse.

To schedule a video call with the Singpass Helpdesk, please click here.


Is this service available when either or both users are based overseas?

This service is available as long as the mobile number is locally registered, i.e., starts with +65. Users who are not able to visit Singpass counter can present their NRIC/FIN to verify their identities and activate Multi-User SMS 2FA over a video call with the Singpass Helpdesk.

Please contact Singpass Helpdesk to set up a video call.

title: What if my facial features change due to personal reasons or unforeseen circumstances (e.g. cosmetic surgery, accident, etc.)?

answer.body: Individuals who no longer resemble their NRIC or passport photograph due to medical reasons (e.g. surgery) can apply for a replacement of their NRIC or passport with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA). This ensures that the Government's biometric database of facial images remains up to date.

title: I encountered error 88-S15-EG-20 on the Singpass app. What should I do?

answer.body:
Please ensure that your device uses Certified Google Play services. If you continue to encounter Error XX-XXX-EG-20 (such as 88-S15-EG-20), your device may not meet the minimum security requirements to run the Singpass app. For the safety of your Singpass account, you will not be able to set up the Singpass app on this device.


Alternatively, you can set up the Singpass app on a different smart device or log in to services with your Singpass ID and password.

title: How do I deactivate Singpass app?

answer.body:
To deactivate Singpass app, you can:

  1. Set up Singpass app on another device

  2. Uninstall and reinstall Singpass App

  3. Reset Singpass app via Setting (Setting > Reset this app)

title: I am unable to suspend my Singpass account through the self-service feature on the hotline. What are my alternatives?

answer.body: Please call Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533, and press “9” for 24-hour scam support. Select “Need other assistance” by pressing “3”, and our helpdesk officer will assist you to suspend your account.

title: When I launch the Singpass app I received a security alert and the app auto closed. What should I do?

answer.body:
We have implemented stringent security measures in the app to better protect your Singpass account and personal data.


  1. If your phone has been rooted/jailbroken, please use another device.

  2. If your phone contains apps that alter the phone settings (e.g. screen capturing or fake GPS apps), please uninstall them before setting up Singpass app.

  3. If the above two scenarios do not apply to you, please contact Singpass Helpdesk here.

title: How can I keep my Singpass account safe?

answer.body:
More security tips:

  • Avoid sharing your Singpass ID, password and Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) details with others.

  • Beware of phishing websites that look like Singpass to trick you into disclosing your login credentials. Check that the web domain is singpass.gov.sg and that there is a 🔒 'lock' icon in the address bar.

  • Look out for transactional alerts from Singpass. If there are suspicious transactions (e.g. you received an SMS on password reset when you did not initiate the change), contact Singpass Helpdesk immediately.

  • Update your contact details registered with Singpass to receive security and transactional alerts promptly.

  • After you have completed your transaction, log out of the digital service.


To read more about Singpass security, visit: https://go.gov.sg/even-safer-singpass.

title: What information would business users be able to view in the Singpass app?

answer.body:
Users can view corporate data retrieved from participating government agencies via the Myinfo business service, such as business registration, shareholder, capital, and appointment holder details. The full list of data items can be found here (grants and licences information are presently not available). 

These data items are official records that businesses have registered with the Government, retrieved from verified government sources (e.g., ACRA, BCA).

title: Can I reply to messages in my inbox?

answer.body: The inbox feature is intended as a one-way notification service. To contact the relevant agencies, you may wish to write in to their respective Quality Service Management (QSM) channels.

title: What is the inbox feature in Singpass app?

answer.body:
You can receive timely notifications from Singpass, such as announcements, transaction alerts and security advisories, in your Singpass app inbox.

To access your inbox, simply follow these steps:

  1. Launch your Singpass app

  2. Tap on Inbox on the menu panel at the bottom

  3. Tap on a message to read its content

title: What are some safeguards put in place for digital signing?

answer.body:
Sign with Singpass adopts cybersecurity measures in line with industry best practices, including a combination of encryption and multi-layered security. IT security measures are also reviewed and updated on a regular basis to better safeguard the digital signing process.


During the signing process, no document data will be transferred between the digital signing partner / business partner's platform and the national digital identity platform. Only a cryptographically random, unintelligible and irreversible code representing the signed document will be transferred during the transaction.

title: What are exceptions where the Digital IC is not accepted? What services require physical identity cards to be presented?
body: Where would Digital IC not be allowed?

answer.body:
From 1 November 2021, Government agencies have accepted the Digital Identity Card (IC) on the Singpass app as an alternative means to prove an individual's identity for in-person agency services.

However, there may be a small number of situations where the physical identity card (e.g. NRIC or long-term pass card) is specifically required, such as the following:

  • Hotel check-ins require physical IC based on National Registration Regulations. This legislation is being reviewed.

  • Investigations under the Criminal Procedure Code and/or the National Registration Act require the physical IC.

  • The National Registration Regulations require the physical IC for these services from ICA: IC registration, re-registration, replacement, citizenship completion of formalities, renunciation of citizenship or PR, revocation or reinstatement of PR.

  • The exchange of a Photo ID is required as collateral for passes to enter secured premises. There are ongoing efforts to progressively implement electronic access control.

  • While the Digital IC is allowed by MOE and SEAB for identification at national examinations, some educational institutions may have other policies concerning the use of mobile phones on premises.


Generally, we are striving to have the Digital IC accepted wherever a form of personal identification is requested. Businesses are also encouraged to accept the Digital IC, though we note that private organisations have their separate operational considerations and may need time to accept and onboard new verification methods.

title: I have deactivated my phone’s front-facing camera and would prefer not to turn it on for Singpass Face Verification. What are my alternatives when prompted for a face scan during app setup?

answer.body:
After entering your Singpass ID and password, if your device does not have a front-facing camera or the camera is disabled, you can request for a PIN to be mailed to your mailing address registered with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA) or Ministry of Manpower (MOM).


Please follow the instructions in the PIN mailer to complete the Singpass app setup.

title: Why am I prompted to enter a verification code?
body: Verification code prompt

answer.body:
This is an additional security feature to confirm your identity and prevent any unauthorised access to your Singpass account.


If you cannot read the verification code, select the 'Refresh Image' link beside the verification code to generate a new code.

title: I am travelling overseas and will be using a Singapore mobile number. Can I still use my Singpass SMS 2FA?
body: Using SMS 2FA while travelling overseas

answer.body:
Yes. If you are using your Singapore-registered mobile number overseas, you should be able to use SMS 2FA and receive notifications.


Note: There may be a lag time in receiving One-Time Passwords via SMS.

title: After I scan the QR code on the Singpass login page, my Singpass app launches and there is a message stating that “this request has expired”. What should I do?
body: Request expired right after scanning QR code

answer.body:
Please ensure that your device is set to update the date and time automatically.


For Android users

  • Go to your phone settings, select "Date & Time", followed by "Set Automatically".

For IOS users

  • Go to "Settings" > "General" > "Date & Time".


The exact steps may differ depending on your device. Once done, you may try logging in using the Singpass app again.

title: What other features will be available for business users in the Singpass app?

answer.body: You can look forward to features such as corporate digital signing and secure login to corporate services through the Singpass app. GovTech will progressively roll out corporate features on the Singpass app to improve and facilitate secure and seamless corporate transactions.

title: How do I use My Cards?

answer.body:
Authentication is required to view the full details of your digital cards. You may tap on the card and verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or 6-digit passcode to access full details.


As more digital identity cards get added, users may either swipe the cards left and right, or tap on the label pills above the card to access each card.

You may refer to these links for more FAQs on the specific cards:

  • Digital IC

  • Practising Certificates (PCs) from the healthcare Professional Boards (AHPC,  OOB , SDC,  SMC , SNB,  SPC , TCMPB)

  • Digital Driving Licence (Digital DL) from the Singapore Police Force (SPF) and HTX (Home Team Science and Technology Agency). Under the dropdown menu at the top, please select “Singapore Driving Licence”

  • Digital LTA Vocational Licence from Land Transport Authority (LTA)

  • Digital Community Health Assist Scheme (CHAS) card from Ministry of Health (MOH)

title: I would prefer not to show my Digital IC on my app's homepage. How can I hide it?

answer.body:
We have implemented an option for users to hide their Digital IC on the home screen from 30 November 2021. Please update your Singpass app to the latest version via the app store to enjoy this feature.

To hide your Digital IC by default (i.e., in the hidden state each time the home screen is shown): 

  • Tap on the Settings menu at the top right corner of the home screen 

  • Toggle on the "Hide personal information" option

  • Your Digital IC will be automatically hidden every time the home screen is shown


To disable the hide by default function: 

  • Tap on the Settings menu at the top right corner of the home screen 

  • Toggle off the "Hide personal information" option

  • Verify your identity with your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode 

  • Your Digital IC will no longer be automatically hidden every time the home screen is shown  


You may also choose to temporarily hide your Digital IC at any time by tapping on the eye icon at the My Cards section. In this case, the app launches the next time in its last saved setting, i.e., the Digital IC stays hidden if you have chosen to hide it before closing the app, and vice versa.

 

To quickly unhide the Digital IC for a transaction, tap on the eye icon and authenticate with your fingerprint, face or passcode. Upon authentication, you will be able to access full details of your Digital IC. You will only be prompted to re-authenticate after 2 minutes.

title: I cannot use the Login Shortcuts on my Singpass app. What should I do?
body: Trouble using login shortcurts

answer.body:
You may not have the required Internet browsers installed on your device.


For Android devices

  • Login Shortcuts are compatible only with the Chrome browser for security reasons. Please install Chrome on your device and try again.


For Huawei devices

  • Login Shortcuts are compatible only with the Huawei browser for security reasons. Please install the Huawei browser on your device and try again.


For iOS devices

  • The mobile Internet browser that launches when you access a service via Login Shortcuts depends on your default mobile browser. For instance, if you have set up Chrome as your default mobile browser, the digital services will launch in the Chrome browser when you tap on the Login Shortcut. This applies to any third-party browser apps, e.g. Firefox and Edge.

title: How do I ensure the Singpass QR code is legitimate?

answer.body:
Singpass never sends QR codes or web links by SMS or messaging apps like WhatsApp or Telegram. You should only scan Singpass QR codes on the login page when accessing digital services using the Singpass app.


Singpass app has stringent security measures in place and will check for the QR codes' legitimacy and validity before you can complete the authentication. You may see an error message on the Singpass app if you have scanned an invalid QR code, and you will not be able to proceed.


When logging in to a service using Singpass, you should also check that the web domain of the Singpass login page is singpass.gov.sg.

title: What is your Profile in the Singpass app?

answer.body:
You can view your data from government sources, such as passport/drivers licence expiry date, CPF contribution history and HDB property information, directly in the app.

To view your Profile, simply follow these steps:

  1. Launch Singpass app

  2. Tap on the relevant Profile category

  3. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode

  4. Your data from government sources will be displayed with sensitive data masked for privacy. Tap on the 'eye' icon on the top right to unmask details


To customise the data displayed, tap on "View all" on the homepage, followed by the setting menu (three dots on the top right) and select "Show/hide categories".

For security, Singpass requires you to authenticate and verify your identity to access personal data. A grace period of 2 minutes is provided for you to switch between different profile categories before you are prompted to authenticate again.

title: How does the Singpass app benefit overseas users?

answer.body: With the Singpass app, overseas users no longer need to wait for SMS One-Time Passwords (OTPs) to come through. They can simply use their mobile phone to log in to digital services with their fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode.

title: Will the Singpass app replace my existing Singpass 2FA methods?

answer.body: The Singpass app does not replace existing Singpass 2FA methods. You can still choose to use your existing Singpass 2FA mode(s), such as SMS 2FA or Face Verification. Singpass app is an alternative mode of 2FA.

title: Why can't I access my account after multiple login attempts?

answer.body:
If you’re unable to access your account after several unsuccessful login attempts, your password login has been locked as a security measure to protect your account. You will receive an SMS notification confirming the password lock and instructions to reset your password.


Here’s what you can do to unlock your account:


1. Use the Singpass App

Even if your password login is locked, you can still securely access Singpass using the Singpass app without delay. Scan (or tap if you are using a mobile browser) the QR code on the login page using your Singpass app, and authenticate with your:

  • Face or fingerprint (if enabled on your device)

  • Six-digit app passcode


2. Reset Your Password to Unlock Your Account

To unlock your password login:

  1. Click here to reset your password

  2. Enter your NRIC or FIN details, followed by Singpass Face Verification or SMS One-Time Password

  3. Create your new Singpass password

Click here for detailed steps to reset your password.


3. Change Your Singpass User ID

If you’re concerned about your NRIC being used as your default Singpass ID, you can change it to a unique identifier that is private and known only to you.

  1. Log in to your account on the Singpass Portal. 

  2. Select the 'Update Profile' icon.

  3. Click the 'Change Singpass ID' button next to your current Singpass ID.

  4. Choose a new Singpass User ID that is not easy to guess and keep it private.


4. Report Harassment Attempts

  • If you suspect that there are malicious attempts to log in to your Singpass account, or if you feel you are being harassed, you may wish to file a police report to address the issue.

  • Additionally, to prevent further misuse, you can consider temporarily suspending your Singpass account. This will block access until you take further action. Learn more here.

title: What should I do if I am accessing Singpass using a public computer?

answer.body:
If you are logging in with Singpass on a public computer,

  • Ensure that the browser does not remember your password.

  • Do not connect to unsecured Wi-Fi networks, as the information you provide may be visible to other users.

  • After you have completed your transaction, log out of the service instead of closing the browser window.

title: Can malicious apps which may have unknowingly been installed on my phone gain access to my personal data displayed in Singpass app?

answer.body:
Your personal data is safeguarded through encryption technology in the Singpass app. Malicious apps would not have access to the data.


As an added security measure, you will be prompted to quit the app immediately if the app detects a potential security breach or the presence of malicious software on your mobile device.

title: Why do I only see none or only some of my Corppass account(s) during the linking and switching process?
body: Some or none of Corppass accounts appearing during linking

answer.body: The Singpass app will only retrieve and display your active Corppass account(s) for local UEN entities currently registered with an Issuance Agency (e.g. ACRA).

title: Will the Singpass app replace Corppass?

answer.body:
The inclusion of corporate features on the Singpass app provides a more convenient and secure access to pertinent corporate data on the go. 


Corppass is currently the single authorisation system for businesses and entities to manage their employees’ access to digital services to perform corporate transactions with the Government. GovTech will progressively roll out new features to improve and facilitate more secure and seamless corporate transactions.

title: My Digital CHAS card does not reflect my data correctly. How do I amend it?
body: Amend info on Digital CHAS card

answer.body: You can call the CHAS hotline at 1800-275-2427. Alternatively, you may write to enquiry@chas.sg on the issue.

title: If my phone is compromised and hackers have access to data on my phone, will they also get my Digital IC data?

answer.body:
Singpass is built to ensure high levels of security, such as requiring verification when accessing important information, like the Digital IC. When threats are detected on the device, the app will lock itself and will not be usable until the threat subsides.

However, there may be rare cases where access can be compromised. It is thus the onus of the individual to ensure secure access to their device and the app (e.g., by not disclosing their PIN or setting up only their own biometric profiles for access to their device) and ensure that threats are minimised. The latter can be prevented by not jailbreaking, not accessing or downloading suspicious materials and performing virus scans.

If you suspect a potential breach, please lodge a police report and contact Singpass Helpdesk at 6335 3533 (press "9" for 24-hour scam support).

title: Why wasn’t my financial information auto-filled on the digital service form, like the rest of my info?

answer.body: Upon Singpass authentication, forms will be auto-populated by pulling your personal data, such as name, NRIC and address, across participating government agencies. However, financial data such as yearly income and CPF statements will always require your consent before any retrieval takes place.

title: What are Login Shortcuts?

answer.body:
Login Shortcuts offer one-tap access to frequently-used digital services directly from the homepage of your Singpass app, for simpler transactions. The list will continue to grow, as we add more relevant shortcuts for you.


To customise your favourite Login Shortcuts on the Singpass app homepage:


  1. Tap on “Edit Favourites” 

  2. Select up to 6 shortcuts that you would like to access quickly

  3. Tap on "Done" to confirm your selection

title: How is my data protected?

answer.body: There are stringent security measures in place to protect our users' personal information. For example, facial data that is retained is encrypted when stored and protected with tamper-evident logging.

title: What is Singpass Face Verification?

answer.body: Singpass Face Verification compares captured facial data against the facial data associated with the specific user from the government’s database.

title: How can I log in to digital services if my Singpass password is locked after multiple failed attempts?

answer.body:
If you are unable to log in with your password, you can still access digital services using these options:


1. Use the Singpass App 

  • You can log in securely to digital services using the Singpass app. 

  • Scan (or tap if you are using a mobile browser) the QR code on the login page using your Singpass app, and authenticate with your: 

    • Face or fingerprint (if set up on your device)

    • Six-digit app passcode


These methods combine two factors: what you have (your phone) and what you know (your PIN) or who you are (your biometric data), ensuring a secure login process.


2. Reset Your Password

If you need to re-enable your password login, you can reset your password.
Click here for instructions on resetting your password.

title: Will Singpass app have access to all my personal files in my phone?

answer.body: The Singpass app requires your "Device ID" to tie your device to your Singpass account as part of the verification process during logins. It is a common requirement for apps to request certain permissions to facilitate transactions. Please be assured that the app does not access, read, or store your personal files.

title: How do I review my Singpass transaction history?

answer.body:
To review your Singpass transaction history:

  1. Log in to your account on the Singpass Portal

  2. Select 'View History' icon


If you are using the Singpass app:

  1. Go to your app settings (gear icon at top right)

  2. Select "Past transactions" > "Singpass transaction history"

  3. Authenticate using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode

title: How can I be sure that my personal data remains secure during the transaction?

answer.body:
Singpass has stringent security measures in place to safeguard your personal data. For example, when you use Singpass app to scan the QR code at the counter, the app will check for the legitimacy of the QR code before requesting for your consent to share the required data with the organisation/government agency. The data will be encrypted and sent securely to the organisation/government agency.

Nonetheless, we urge users to be vigilant when transacting online. You can ACT against scams:

  • Add the Singpass app only from the official app stores (Apple App Store, Google Play Store, Huawei AppGallery)

  • Check that the web domain is singpass.gov.sg before entering your details

  • Tell Singpass Helpdesk if something is amiss - call 6335 3533 and press “9”

title: Will I be able to unlink my Corppass accounts in the Singpass app after linking them?
body: Unlinking Corppass accounts in Singpass app

answer.body:
Yes, you can unlink your Corppass accounts in the Singpass app by tapping "Unlink corporate accounts" in the app settings.

Once you unlink your Corppass accounts from the Singpass app, you will not be able to access corporate data related to your entities in the device. You may link your Corppass accounts to the Singpass app again later.

title: Why are all types of Corppass account holders within my business/organisation able to view entity information on the Singpass app?

answer.body: The entity information on the Singpass app (via My Corporate Profile) is consolidated from publicly available data from various Government sources to enable business users more convenient and secure access to corporate data. All Corppass account holders within the same business/organisation are individuals authorised by the business/organisation on the Corppass portal to transact with the Government in a business capacity. Hence, they will be able to view entity information on the Singpass app after completing user authentication during the one-time business profile setup on the Singpass app.

title: Is it safe to link my Corppass account(s) to my Singpass app? How can I be sure that my corporate data on the Singpass app is not easily accessible to others?

answer.body:
User authentication with your biometrics (fingerprint or face) or a 6-digit passcode is required to link Corppass accounts on the Singpass app. You are also required to verify your identity before viewing any corporate data on your business profile. A 2-minute grace period is provided, allowing you to easily switch between one section or service to another, after which user authentication will be required again.


You are advised to secure your device and its contents with a strong password, and only register your own fingerprint or facial biometrics for access to the device. You should not share a screenshot or recording of your corporate data with other individuals.


Should you misplace your device, you can install the app on another device to deactivate your app on your old device or contact Singpass Helpdesk for assistance.

title: How can business users access My Corporate Profile within the Singpass app?
body: How to access My Corporate Profile?

answer.body:
Users are first required to link their Corppass account(s) to the Singpass app. Please follow these steps:


  1. Tap on the Settings menu (gear icon) on the Singpass app homepage  

  2. Select ‘Link Corporate Accounts’ and tap ‘Next’  

  3. Verify your identity with your fingerprint, face, or six-digit passcode. Upon successful authentication, the app will retrieve and link your valid Corppass account(s)


After linking your Corppass account(s), you would then be able to switch to your preferred account(s) seamlessly and securely. The steps are as follows:

  1. Tap on ‘Switch Account’ on the Singpass app homepage  

  2. Verify your identity with your fingerprint, face, or six-digit passcode 

  3. Select your preferred Corppass account and view its corporate data from the My Corporate Profile section


If you would like to use this feature but do not have a valid Corppass account, please approach your business entity’s Corppass Administrator for assistance. Alternatively, if you have been nominated as a Corppass Administrator by your entity's Registered Officer (RO), you may click here to register for a Corppass Administrator account.

title: What is the My Corporate Profile feature in the Singpass app?

answer.body: My Corporate Profile allows individuals authorised by businesses and other entities, such as non-profit organisations and associations, to access and view selected corporate data on the Singpass app. You need to have an active Corppass account for a local UEN entity currently registered with an Issuance Agency (e.g. ACRA) to be able to use this feature.

title: My Digital LTA Vocational Licence does not reflect my data correctly. How do I amend it?
body: Amend info on Digital LTA Vocational Licence

answer.body:
You may reach out to LTA via their:


  • Online Contact Form (https://www.lta.gov.sg/feedback)

  • LTA website (https://www.lta.gov.sg) > Contact Us > Write to Us

title: My Digital Driving Licence (Digital DL) does not reflect my data correctly. How do I amend it?
body: Amend info on Digital Driving Licence

answer.body: You may reach out to SPF via their Online Feedback Form (http://go.gov.sg/ddlfeedback).

title: What is the My Cards feature in the Singpass app?

answer.body:
The My Cards feature allows users to conveniently access Government-issued identity cards for personal and professional identification. As more Government-issued identity cards become available in a digital format, they will be progressively added to My Cards.


Users can access the other cards by either swiping the cards under the My Cards, or by tapping on the labels above the card. Authentication is required to view the full details of your digital cards.

title: How do I know the Digital IC is legitimate?

answer.body:
The Digital IC has an animated lion crest with a holographic effect at the corner of the user's photograph to deter image tampering and screenshot spoofing. The lion crest is absent or appears static if a person attempts to capture a screen recording of the Digital IC.

Agencies and businesses should check for this animated lion crest with holographic effect to ascertain that the Digital IC screen is legitimate, and request for users to tap on their device to verify that the presented identity credentials are not captured images or videos.

title: What is the Digital IC?
body: Digital IC

answer.body:
The Digital IC is a feature in your Singpass app that displays your name, NRIC number/FIN, photograph, date of birth, sex, nationality, date of issue, registered address, pass type and status, pass issue and expiry date, and other additional fields for work passes such as the employer and sector.


You can tap on the Digital IC card and verify your identity to display more personal details, such as your date of birth, registered address, etc. You can also tap on the eye icon to unmask the NRIC number/FIN and tap on "Show barcode" to scan your NRIC/FIN barcode at kiosks, such as those at libraries and SingHealth polyclinics.


There may be a small number of situations where the physical identity card (e.g. NRIC or long-term pass card) is specifically required. Please refer to the exception list here.


Businesses are also encouraged to accept the Digital IC, though we note that private organisations have their separate operational considerations and may need time to accept and onboard new verification methods.

title: Why isn’t my financial information showing up in my Singpass app profile?

answer.body:
Due to scheduled maintenance during low transaction periods, IRAS and CPF information will be unavailable at the following times:


CPFB:

  • Every day 5:00 am to 5:30 am (UTC +8 hours)

IRAS:

  • Every Wed, 2:00 am to 6:00 am (UTC +8 hours)

  • Every Sun, 2:00 am to 8:30 am (UTC +8 hours)


We seek your understanding as we work with CPFB and IRAS to minimise inconvenience.

title: Who else can access my profile information?

answer.body: No personal data will be shared with participating digital services until you have logged in and authenticated yourself with your Singpass.

title: How do I provide my information to businesses using the Singpass app?

answer.body:
Let's say you are at a registration counter:

  1. Launch your Singpass app

  2. Scan the Singpass QR code displayed at the counter

  3. View the data that needs to be shared and give your consent to proceed

  4. Verify your identity using your fingerprint, face or six-digit passcode

  5. Your data will be sent across securely, and you're done!

You can currently use the Singpass app to provide your details at selected counters. More businesses will be on board soon.

title: What are the supported browsers for Singpass?

answer.body:
On personal computers, you may access Singpass using these browsers:

  • Google Chrome versions: 114 and above

  • Mozilla Firefox versions: 115 and above

  • Microsoft Edge versions: 114 and above

  • Safari versions: 16 and above 


On mobile operating systems, you may access Singpass using these browsers:

  • Safari versions: 16 and above

  • Chrome versions: 114 above

Please note that Singpass may not work on older web browser versions and users are advised to upgrade to the latest versions. Outdated web browsers, where security updates have been discontinued by the product developers, may pose security risks to your Singpass account.


For more information on device operating systems (e.g. Windows XP, Windows 10, macOS Sierra) that support the above web browser versions, please refer to the respective product developers' website.

title: Which organisations are allowed to display the Singpass QR code?

answer.body: The Government will only issue the Singpass QR code to businesses or government agencies using Singpass to verify the identity of their customers. The Singpass QR code is unique to each business/government agency, and can only request for a set of data, pre-approved by the Government, to be collected for verification purposes.

title: How do I log in to private sector digital services using Singpass?

answer.body:
As part of the National Digital Identity initiative, the Singpass team is working with industry partners to extend the use of Singpass app to private sector services. This saves users the hassle of remembering different login credentials when transacting online. 

Singpass users can log in to participating private organisations' digital services using the Singpass app only. With the Singpass app, users can tap/ scan the Singpass QR code on the login page and authenticate using their face, fingerprint or six-digit passcode.

title: Can I choose to skip/opt out of the additional security verification when setting up my Singpass app?

answer.body: You cannot skip or opt out of the additional security verification as it is an added measure to mitigate scams and prevent unauthorised access to your Singpass account.

title: What is strong versus weak biometrics?

answer.body: Android tests the biometric implementation of mobile devices and classifies them as “Strong”, “Weak” or “Convenience” depending on how well they can guard against spoofing attempts (e.g. unlocking a user’s phone using a recorded sample). Read more about Android’s biometric security classification at https://source.android.com/security/biometric/measure.

title: I am a Donee appointed under a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or a Court-appointed Deputy. Can I set up the Multi-User SMS 2FA for the secondary user without needing the secondary user to be physically present?
body: Setting up without secondary user present

answer.body:
Yes, the secondary user does not need to provide consent and does not need to be physically present in this case, if he/she lacks mental capacity.

The Donee appointed under a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or a Court-appointed Deputy should set up their Multi-User SMS 2FA by submitting the LPA document and a medical report certifying the Donors loss of mental capacity, or the Deputyship court order via the links respective links below:


  • Donees with LPA: [https://go.gov.sg/multi-user-donee]

  • Deputies with a Court Order: [https://go.gov.sg/multi-user-deputy]


The Singpass Helpdesk will contact you at the email address provided in the application form after your application has been processed, or if more information is required.

Please allow up to 10 working days for the Singpass Helpdesk to process the documents and reach out to you.

title: What if one of the parties is unable to be physically present at the counter to verify their identities?

answer.body:
The arrangement of having both parties present to verify their identities is necessary to safeguard the interest of our users and to avoid any potential misuse.

If you have difficulties in being present physically, please contact the Singpass Helpdesk. The Helpdesk will assist in conducting a video call with both parties as part of the required verification process.

title: I am a Donee appointed under a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA). What are the documents I have to submit in order to set up Multi-user SMS 2FA on behalf of the Donor?

answer.body:
Donees are required to submit the following supporting documents:


  1. Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) that appoints you to make decisions on the Donors behalf 

  2. Medical Report certifying the Donors lack of mental capacity. Please note that:

    • The Medical Report must be issued by a certified medical practitioner registered with the Singapore Medical Council.  

    • The Medical Report must clearly state the Doctor's opinion on the Donor's mental capacity.  

    • The Medical Report must be dated after the date of LPA registration. 

    • If the Donor's loss of mental capacity is not permanent, the Medical Report must be dated within the last 6 months.


You may upload the supporting documents via the Multi-User SMS 2FA application form for Donees here: [https://go.gov.sg/multi-user-donee]


If there is more than one Donee appointed under the LPA and the LPA states that the Donees are required to act 'jointly', each Donee will be required to submit this form separately.

title: Once the Multi-user SMS 2FA is activated, does the primary user get to see all the secondary user’s information?

answer.body:
The only information that primary users of the mobile number will be able to see is the SMS-OTP. This means that the primary user will not be privy to the type of service that the secondary user is accessing.

Secondary users will still receive direct communications from the Government via mailers and not via the primary users mobile number.

title: What transactions will require Singpass 2FA?

answer.body: You need Singpass 2FA to perform government digital transactions that involve sensitive information, such as filing taxes and viewing CPF statements. Click here for a list of digital services that require 2FA.

title: How do I change my preferred mode of contact?
body: Change preferred mode of contact

answer.body:
To change your preferred code of contact:


  1. Log in to your account at Singpass Portal

  2. Select ‘Update Profile’ icon

title: How can I update the data in My Corporate Profile?

answer.body:
My Corporate Profile consists of data retrieved from Government sources, reflecting what has been registered and verified with the source agency. Please contact the relevant source agency to update any information.


  • To update data related to entity profile, address, previous UENs & names, appointments, shareholders, capital and financial highlights, please approach the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA) via BizFile at this link.

  • To update data related to builders & contractor information, please approach the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) via eBACs. You may click here for instructions to access eBACS.


After the source agency has verified your information and processed the data update, it will take 1-3 working days for the information to be reflected on your Singpass app.

title: How do I know if my Corppass account(s) is valid to use the My Corporate Profile feature?

answer.body:
You will be able to link or switch to your Corppass accounts only if they fulfil the following criteria:


  1. Your Corppass account is ‘Active’ 

    • Corppass accounts that are 'Suspended', 'Terminated', 'Inactive', 'Rejected' are not allowed. Please check with your Corppass Administrator if you are unsure about your current account status.

  2. Your entity is a local UEN entity 

    • Corppass accounts in non-UEN/foreign entities, GSTN entities and ASGD entities will not be reflected at this time. You may check with your Corppass Administrator for your entity type.

  3. Your entity’s UEN status on ACRA is 'Registered’ 

    • Corppass accounts in 'De-Registered' and 'Withdrawn' entities will not be reflected. You may check with your Corppass Administrator for the UEN’s status on ACRA system.

title: What type of documents will be added to my Document Wallet?

answer.body:
For a start, users who intend to travel may visit the Notαrise to obtain their HealthCerts directly within the Singpass app. Issuance of a Vaccination HealthCert for a dependent (i.e. your vaccinated child) will also be added here.


These HealthCerts include Vaccination certificates and Pre-Departure Test (PDT) certificates. PDT certificates can refer to Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) tests, Antigen Rapid Tests (ART), or Serology tests administered officially by a recognised medical facility.

More document types will be added in the future.

title: Where can I download the Root National Certificate Authority (NCA) certificate?

answer.body:
1. You can download and install the NCA certificate from:

  • IMDA: https://www.imda.gov.sg/regulations-and-licensing-listing/electronic-transactions-act-and-regulations/controller-of-certification-authorities/accredited-cas-in-singapore

  • Assurity NCA: https://www.nca.gov.sg/SNRCA-G1.cer

  • GovTech NCA :https://repository.nca.gov.sg/RCA-B1.crt


  1. How to check if i am issued with GovTech or ATS cert

    • Navigate to Auth Certificate Information

      • From Main Page > Click Setting Icon ⚙️ > Under “Your Singpass Account” Click Digital Identity details > Click “Your Authentication Certificate”

        • Refer to Screen 2 - Navigating to Authentication/Signing Cert Information

    • Check if the issuer is “Government Technology Agency” or “Assurity Trusted Solution Pte Ltd”

      • Refer to Screen 3 - Auth Cert Issuer Validation

title: What is a signing certificate?

answer.body: You may request for a signing certificate from the National Certification Authority (NCA) for the purposes of digitally signing agreements or authorising transactions. This certificate cryptographically binds your identity to information that will be used to verify your digital signature. The signing certificate contains information that is a means of identifying you to the digital service.

title: How do I verify that the digital signature belongs to the designated signee?

answer.body:
Open the document in Adobe Acrobat Reader (ensure you have the latest version installed) > click on the signature you wish to verify > click on the “Details” tab in the Certificate Viewer dialog box. The signer’s full name and last four NRIC characters will be displayed in the “Subject Field”. 




Additionally, you should check that the “Issuer” is listed as “Singapore NDI Intermediate CA” and “Assurity Trusted Solutions Pte Ltd or Government Technology Agency”.

title: Will signed documents be stored in Singpass app?

answer.body: Signed documents will not be stored in your Singpass app.

title: I have just set up my Singpass app and could access full details on my Digital IC without authenticating. Why is this so?

answer.body:
We have made it easier for users to navigate the app during a transaction by offering a 2-minute grace period upon authentication for users to switch from one category/service to another before authenticating again.

You have authenticated during the app setup and accessed the Digital IC details within the 2-minute grace period. Please exit the app, wait for 2 minutes, and try accessing the Digital IC again. You will be prompted to verify your identity before full details can be displayed.

title: For transactions with commercial entities, what data will be retrieved from my profile?

answer.body: Commercial entities can only request personal data that is required for their forms and to process your transaction. Your consent will always be sought before any personal data is retrieved.

title: What are some security measures to protect my profile data?

answer.body: You are required to verify your identity to access your personal data on the Singpass app. When the displayed data is left inactive for some time, you will be prompted to authenticate again to view the details. This will help prevent unauthorised access to the data.

title: Can I choose not to display some of my data in my Singpass app profile?

answer.body:
Yes, you can customise the data displayed by following these steps:

  1. Tap on the settings menu at the top right-hand corner of the profile 

  2. Select ‘Show/hide categories’

  3. Select the categories that you would like to display

title: How can users provide feedback on the translations?

answer.body: GovTech welcomes the public to co-create a better Singpass with us by leaving feedback on how the translations can be improved via the “Give us feedback” form in the Singpass app settings.

title: Why does the Singpass app support only strong biometrics?

answer.body: Singpass has stepped up its security measures and requirements to protect users against malware-related scams that have become more prevalent. This includes supporting only strong biometrics, which requires meeting more stringent criteria and higher level of accuracy for a successful authentication.

title: What strong biometrics can I set up?

answer.body: You may try setting up fingerprint authentication which is classified as strong biometrics on most devices. However, please note that the classification of your device’s fingerprint biometrics may vary depending on the device model and hardware.

title: I am a Deputy appointed under a Deputyship Court Order. What are the documents that I have to submit in order to set up Multi-User SMS 2FA on behalf of the person lacking mental capacity?

answer.body:
Deputies are required to submit a copy of the Court Order as a supporting document. You may upload the Court Order via the Multi-User SMS 2FA application form for Deputies here.

If there is more than one Deputy appointed under the Court Order and the Court Order states that the Deputies are required to act 'jointly', each Deputy is required to submit this form separately.

title: Is it compulsory for me to use Multi-user SMS 2FA? Can I continue to use existing methods?

answer.body: It is not compulsory to use Multi-user SMS 2FA. We encourage users to first explore other existing 2FA methods such as Singpass app, SMS One-Time Password (SMS-OTP), or Face Verification. However, we also recognise that some users might find Multi-user SMS 2FA to be a more convenient option.

title: What are my alternatives if I do not own a device with a front-facing camera to perform Singpass Face Verification?

answer.body: Please contact us. Alternatively, please visit an agency’s kiosk enabled with Singpass Face Verification (e.g. CPF Service Centres, IRAS Taxpayer and Business Service Centre, and ServiceSG Centres).

title: Will someone who looks a lot like me, or a twin, be able to impersonate me?

answer.body: Biometrics will not be used as the sole authentication factor for more sensitive transactions. This ensures that someone with similar facial features (e.g. identical twins) will not be able to access your account. Additional authentication factors (e.g. password, SMS-OTP, Singpass app) may be required on top of biometrics.

title: Can I choose to turn off the additional security verification feature?

answer.body: The additional security verification feature cannot be turned off as it helps to protect your Singpass account and safeguards against unauthorised logins.

title: How can I protect myself if someone misuses my NRIC to log into my Singpass account?
body: If you suspect someone is attempting to misuse your NRIC for repeated login attempts, here are the steps you can take to protect yourself.

answer.body:
1. Report the Incident to the Authorities

  • If you suspect that there are malicious attempts to log in to your Singpass account, or if you feel you are being harassed, you may wish to file a police report to address the issue.

  • Additionally, to prevent further misuse, you can consider temporarily suspending your Singpass account. This will block access until you take further action. Learn more here. 


2. Update Your Singpass User ID

To reduce the inconvenience of such incidents, you can change your Singpass User ID to a unique user ID that is private and known only to you. This adds an extra layer of protection to your account and makes it harder for malicious actors to gain unauthorised access.


Here’s how to update your Singpass User ID:

  1. Log in to your account on the Singpass Portal. 

  2. Click on the 'Update Profile' icon.

3. Click on the 'Change Singpass ID' button next to your current Singpass ID.

4. Choose a new Singpass User ID that is not easy to guess and keep it private.


For more details on changing your Singpass ID, click here.


3. Keep Your Account Secure

  • Your Singpass account is protected by your password and Two-Factor Authentication (2FA). Ensure that your password, app passcode and new Singpass User ID remain private.

  • Be cautious of phishing attempts or fraudulent links asking for your Singpass credentials, and check that the website domain is singpass.gov.sg before entering your login credentials. 

  • Check your transaction history and report any suspicious activities.

title: Can I use the corporate features in other languages?

answer.body: The corporate features in the Singpass app, including My Corporate Profile, are currently only available in English. Translations for the Singpass app have been rolled out progressively since February 2022 and will be extended to more app features in a phased approach.

title: If I am assigned Corppass account(s) for other business entities after the initial setup, would I need to link the additional Corppass account(s) to my Singpass app?
body: Auto linking future Corppass accounts assigned to you

answer.body: The one-time account setup seeks your consent to link existing and future Corppass accounts. Subsequently, the app will retrieve and display the latest list of Corppass account(s) that you are authorised to access every time you tap on ‘Switch Account’. You are not required to manually link Corppass account(s) assigned to you after the initial setup. This applies to the removal of Corppass accounts assigned to you as well.

title: Who can access My Corporate Profile on the Singpass app?

answer.body: Only Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and Singpass Foreign user Account (SFA) users with an active Corppass account for a local UEN entity registered with an Issuance Agency (e.g. ACRA), will be able to access My Corporate Profile on the Singpass app. This feature will be progressively extended to other Corppass users in the future.

title: How do I configure Adobe Acrobat Reader to automatically validate the digital signature generated using Sign with Singpass in a signed document?
body: Configure Adobe Acrobat Reader to auto validate

answer.body:
Please refer to the PDF guide to setup and configure Adobe Acrobat Reader to automatically validate the digital signature generated using Sign with Singpass in a signed document:


Loading Singpass root signing certificate.pdf

title: I am unable to scan my Singpass Digital IC barcode at counters/kiosks. Why is this so?

answer.body:
The Digital IC barcode has been enhanced to accommodate different device bezels.

Unsuccessful barcode scanning may also be due to the use of incompatible barcode scanners, which at times are unable to read accurately due to light interferences or anti-reflective coating/protectors.

To increase the chances of successful scanning, you may like to try adjusting the screen brightness or the phone's angle during scanning.

title: Why is there a change in the data fields available?

answer.body: Singpass strives to make your profile more comprehensive and useful for future transactions. The data fields may be reassessed from time to time to provide relevant data from government sources and remove the need for you to fill out forms or submit supporting documents.

title: Can I delete my profile?

answer.body: No. If you do not wish to use your profile in digital transactions, you may choose to enter the required data manually. You may need to submit supporting documents to the service provider for verification.

title: For government digital transactions, what data will be retrieved upon Singpass authentication?

answer.body:
Personal data relevant to the transaction, such as the data found on your NRIC, will be pulled into forms upon Singpass authentication.  

Consent will always be sought for transactions that require the relevant confidential data from government sources, such as your yearly income and CPF statements.

title: After I have consented to share specific data for a digital service transaction, will the digital service have access to all my data from my profile?

answer.body: Participating digital services will only retrieve the required data fields as specified in the online forms at the point of transaction. No additional information will be shared.

title: What are the key functions available in my Singpass app profile?

answer.body:
1. View your profile: You must have an active Singpass account and Singpass mobile application set up on your mobile phone to access your information

  2. View your Transaction History: You can view transactions associated with your profile that have occurred over the past 6 months

  3. Manage your settings: You can configure what information is displayed in your profile

title: What is the multi-language feature in Singpass?
body: Multi language support

answer.body:
To ensure services are easily accessible, the Singpass app is available in Singapore’s four official languages: English, Chinese, Malay and Tamil. Users can switch to their preferred language in the app settings.


Why are some parts of the Singpass app, e.g. messages in the inbox, not translated?

The translations are rolled out progressively from February 2022, and will be extended to more features in a phased approach. Messages sent to the Singpass app inbox will be in the same language used by the government agency sending the notification. We will be working with other government agencies to offer multilingual notifications for selected messages in future.

title: How can I terminate the Multi-User SMS 2FA service?

answer.body: Either party may visit any of the Singpass counters islandwide to terminate the Multi-User SMS 2FA.

title: Can the secondary user be linked to more than one primary user's mobile number?

answer.body: No. As a security feature, the secondary user's account can only be linked to one mobile user at any one time.
